``–ë–µ—Ä–¥—è–Ω—Å–∫`` –∏ ``–ù–∏–∫–æ–ø–æ–ª—å``, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –±—É–∫—Å–∏—Ä ``–Ø–Ω—ã –ö–∞–ø—É``. –û–± —ç—Ç–æ–º 17 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è —Å–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–æ–π –Ω–∞ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫ –≤ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∞—Ö —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç¬†–¢–ê–°–°. –ü–æ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –∏–∑ —á–∏—Å–ª–∞ –≤–µ—â–¥–æ–∫–æ–≤ –∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∞ –∏ –±—É–∫—Å–∏—Ä –∏—Å–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω—ã –¥–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–µ–ª–∞ —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–æ–≤ –≤ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º —Å—É–¥–µ. 25 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è 2018 –≥–æ–¥–∞¬†–†–§ –æ–±—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª—è–ª–∞ –∏ –∑–∞—Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∞ –≤ –ß–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–º –º–æ—Ä–µ¬†–∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∞ ``–ë–µ—Ä–¥—è–Ω—Å–∫`` –∏ ``–ù–∏–∫–æ–ø–æ–ª—å``, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –±—É–∫—Å–∏—Ä ``–Ø–Ω—ã –ö–∞–ø—É``, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤ –û–¥–µ—Å—Å—É –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –ö–µ—Ä—á–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ–ª–∏–≤ –≤ –ê–∑–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–µ –º–æ—Ä–µ. –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å–∏–ª–æ–≤–∏–∫–∏ –∑–∞–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–ª–∏ 24 —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–∞, –ø–æ–∑–∂–µ –∏—Ö –∞—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ –≤ –∫—Ä—ã–º—Å–∫–∏—Ö ``—Å—É–¥–∞—Ö`` –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–µ–∑–ª–∏ –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤—É. –í—Å–µ–º¬†—É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Ü–∞–º –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ä—è–≤–∏–ª–∏ –æ–±–≤–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è¬†–≤ –Ω–µ–∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Å–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ü—ã –†–§. –í –∞–ø—Ä–µ–ª–µ 2019 –≥–æ–¥–∞¬†–£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–∞ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –≤ –ú–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π —Ç—Ä–∏–±—É–Ω–∞–ª¬†–ø–æ –º–æ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–º—É –ø—Ä–∞–≤—É,¬†–ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–≤ –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ä¬†–æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç—å –†–§ –Ω–µ–º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ—Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–æ–≤ –∏ –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª–∏.¬†–†–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∞—è —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∞—Å—å –æ—Ç —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—è¬†–≤ —Å–ª—É—à–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö. 25 –º–∞—è —Ç—Ä–∏–±—É–Ω–∞–ª –≤ –ì–∞–º–±—É—Ä–≥–µ¬†–æ–±—è–∑–∞–ª –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—é –Ω–µ–º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ—Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å¬†—Ç—Ä–∏ –∑–∞–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª—è, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ 24 –∑–∞–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–∞ –∏ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç—å –∏–º –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—É.¬†–°—Ä–æ–∫ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏—Å—Ç–µ–∫ 25 –∏—é–Ω—è. 7 —Å–µ–Ω—Ç—è–±—Ä—è –º–µ–∂–¥—É –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–æ–π –∏ –†–§¬†—Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–ª—Å—è –æ–±–º–µ–Ω —É–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–º–∏ –ª–∏—Ü–∞–º–∏¬†–≤ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ ``35 –Ω–∞ 35``.¬†–°—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–≤—à–∏—Ö—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω—É¬†‚Äì¬†–∑–∞—Ö–≤–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–µ–π –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –∏–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ —É –ö–µ—Ä—á–µ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ª–∏–≤–∞ 24 —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–∞. –ê–¥–≤–æ–∫–∞—Ç –ù–∏–∫–æ–ª–∞–π¬†–ü–æ–ª–æ–∑–æ–≤ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–æ–≤¬†–æ—Ç–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏ –ø–æ–¥ –ø–æ—Ä—É—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–æ¬†—É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –æ–º–±—É–¥—Å–º–µ–Ω–∞ –õ—é–¥–º–∏–ª—ã –î–µ–Ω–∏—Å–æ–≤–æ–π. –í –æ–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä–µ –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä –∏–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–µ–ª –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã –í–∞–¥–∏–º –ü—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–π–∫–æ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ –≤¬†–±–ª–∏–∂–∞–π—à–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è¬†–≤–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–µ –≤–æ–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª–∏. –û–Ω —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–∞ –∏ –†–§ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –ø–æ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—É –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–æ–≤ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è ``–Ω–∞ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º —ç—Ç–∞–ø–µ``. –ü–æ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º –∑–∞–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –∏–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–µ–ª –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã –ï–ª–µ–Ω—ã –ó–µ—Ä–∫–∞–ª—å, –ö–∏–µ–≤ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º—É–º —Å–µ–º—å —Ä–∞–∑¬†–æ–±—Ä–∞—â–∞–ª—Å—è –∫ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–º –≤–ª–∞—Å—Ç—è–º¬†—Å —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª–∏. –í –°–æ–≤—Ñ–µ–¥–µ –†–§¬†—Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ –æ—Ç –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–æ–≤ –±—ã–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏, –¥–ª—è —Ç–æ–≥–æ —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–ª–∞ –∑–∞—Ö–≤–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª–∏. 15 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∞—è –≥–∞–∑–µ—Ç–∞ ``–ö–æ–º–º–µ—Ä—Å–∞–Ω—Ç—ä``, —Å—Å—ã–ª–∞—è—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–æ–∏ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∏, –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª–∞, —á—Ç–æ¬†–†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è –Ω–∞–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–∞ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å¬†–∑–∞—Ö–≤–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏–µ –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª–∏ –¥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–∞–º–º–∏—Ç–∞ –≤ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–¥—Å–∫–æ–º —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ. –í –ú–ò–î –†–§¬†–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ü–∞–ª–∏ —Å–≤—è–∑—å¬†–º–µ–∂–¥—É –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ –±—É–∫—Å–∏—Ä–∞ –∏ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–µ–π ``–ù–æ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–¥—Å–∫–æ–π —á–µ—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∏``. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∏–ª–∞ —Ä–∞–¥–∏–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–∏—è¬†``–ö–µ—Ä—á—å.–§–ú``,¬†17 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è –≤–æ–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∞ ``–ë–µ—Ä–¥—è–Ω—Å–∫`` –∏ ``–ù–∏–∫–æ–ø–æ–ª—å``, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –±—É–∫—Å–∏—Ä ``–Ø–Ω—ã –ö–∞–ø—É`` –≤—ã–≤–µ–ª–∏ –∏–∑ –ö–µ—Ä—á–∏, –æ–Ω–∏¬†–ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–∏ –ø–æ–¥ –ö–µ—Ä—á–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–º –º–æ—Å—Ç–æ–º.
__label__science –ú–µ–¥–∏–∫–∏ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–ª–∏ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–æ–∫, –ø—Ä–æ–¥–ª–µ–≤–∞—é—â–∏–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å –ù–∞—Å—á–µ—Ç –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∫–∞ —Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏–π. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –æ –µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–µ –¥–ª—è —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ –ù–∞–ø–∏—Ç–æ–∫, –≤—ã–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–π —Å—Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Å–ø–æ—Ä–æ–≤ —ç—Ç–æ, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ –∂–µ, –∫–æ—Ñ–µ. –°–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã —Å—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è –≤–æ –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏, —á—Ç–æ –µ–≥–æ –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –ø–∏—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –≥–æ–ª–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –∂–µ–ª—É–¥–æ–∫, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Å —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ —É—Ç—Ä–∞. –û–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ –µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ù–æ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–π –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–ª–µ–≤–∞–µ—Ç –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å –∏ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–º, –Ω–µ–∂–µ–ª–∏ –≤—Ä–µ–¥–Ω—ã–º –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∫–æ–º. –û–± —ç—Ç–æ–º —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞–ª ¬´–ú–µ–¥–∏–∫—Ñ–æ—Ä—É–º¬ª. –ò—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–µ –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–æ, —á—Ç–æ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤–ª–∏—è–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏, –¥–ª–∏–ª–æ—Å—å 12 –ª–µ—Ç. –¢–µ, –∫—Ç–æ –µ–∂–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω–æ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞–ª —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏—é –∫–æ—Ñ–µ–ø–∏—Ç–∏—è, –∑–∞ —É–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä–∏–æ–¥ —É–º–∏—Ä–∞–ª–∏ —Ä–µ–∂–µ. –î–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç —É—á–µ–Ω—ã–µ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω—è—é—Ç –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º —á–∏—Å–ª–æ–º –∞–Ω—Ç–∏–æ–∫—Å–∏–¥–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–≤—à–∏—Ö—Å—è –≤ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ. –ò–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –∑–∞–º–µ–¥–ª—è—é—Ç –æ–∫–∏—Å–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—ã –∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä—É—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫–ª–µ—Ç–æ–∫. –ê, –∫–∞–∫ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ, –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ–∫–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –≤–µ–¥–µ—Ç –∫ —Ä–∏—Å–∫—É –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–Ω–æ–≤–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∞–∫–∞ –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–¥–µ—á–Ω–æ-—Å–æ—Å—É–¥–∏—Å—Ç—ã—Ö –∑–∞–±–æ–ª–µ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π. –≠–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—ã —Ä–∞—Å—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ –≤ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ–π–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ö —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ 1 —Ç—ã—Å. –∞–Ω—Ç–∏–æ–∫—Å–∏–¥–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, –ø—Ä–∏—á–µ–º –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ –∏—Ö –Ω–∏—Ö –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–µ –æ–±–∂–∞—Ä–∫–∏. –û—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É –æ—Ç –∫–æ—Ñ–µ, –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –ø–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 4 —á–∞—à–µ–∫ –≤ –¥–µ–Ω—å. –ü–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞—Å—å —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è? –ü–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ, –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞, –≤–∞—à –ª–∞–π–∫ –∏¬†–ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –Ω–∞ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –µ—â–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤ –±—É–¥—É—â–µ–º. –ó–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ —Å–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ!
__label__society –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏–µ –≤–æ–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ–¥–Ω—è–ª–∏ —Ñ–ª–∞–≥–∏ –°–®–ê –≤ –î–æ–Ω–±–∞—Å—Å–µ –ó–≤–µ–∑–¥–Ω–æ-–ø–æ–ª–æ—Å–∞—Ç—ã–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ—Ç–Ω–∏—â–∞ –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –Ω–∞–¥ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ –í–°–£ –≤ –Ω–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É–Ω–∫—Ç–∞—Ö –ö—Ä—ã–º—Å–∫–æ–µ –∏ –ú–∏—Ä–æ–Ω–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∏—Ä—ã –¥–≤—É—Ö –±—Ä–∏–≥–∞–¥ —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π –∞—Ä–º–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏ –≤—ã–≤–µ—Å–∏—Ç—å —Ñ–ª–∞–≥–∏ –°–®–ê –Ω–∞–¥ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ –í–°–£ –≤ –î–æ–Ω–±–∞—Å—Å–µ. –û–± —ç—Ç–æ–º —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç –õ—É–≥–∞–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä —Å–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–æ–π –Ω–∞ –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–µ—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å-—Å–ª—É–∂–±—ã —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –ù–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –º–∏–ª–∏—Ü–∏–∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∑–≥–ª–∞—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –õ–ù–† –ò–≤–∞–Ω–∞ –§–∏–ª–∏–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω–∫–æ. –†–µ—á—å –∏–¥–µ—Ç –æ–± —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è—Ö –≤ —Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω–µ –Ω–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—É–Ω–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –ö—Ä—ã–º—Å–∫–æ–µ –∏ –ú–∏—Ä–æ–Ω–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π. –ò–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–æ—à–µ–ª 16 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è. –û—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ —Ñ–ª–∞–≥–∏ –°–®–ê –≤—ã–≤–µ—Å–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–∞–∫–∞–Ω—É–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–µ–∑–¥–∞ –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∞ –∞–º–µ—Ä–∏–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π –≥–∞–∑–µ—Ç—ã The New York Times –•–æ—Ñ—Ñ–º–∞–Ω–∞ –í—ç–π–Ω–∞.
__label__entertainment GOT7's 'You Calling My Name' M/V hits 40M views on YouTube GOT7's 'You Calling My Name' has¬†hit 40M views on YouTube! The song was revealed on November 4¬†and the MV hit over 40 million views just in 13 days. Congratulations to GOT7! You can check out their MV below.
__label__society 'Golden age' for Indian aviation sector: IndiGo chief With strong fundamentals, India's civil aviation sector is in its ``golden age`` and there is also healthy competition among domestic carriers, IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta has said. Interestingly, the country's civil aviation sector has been experiencing lower growth in traffic compared to previous years and there has also been softness in fares in October, according to industry experts. The traffic grew just 1.18 per cent in September, as per the latest available official data. IndiGo, owned by InterGlobe Aviation, is the country's largest airline with a market share of 48.2 per cent in September. While acknowledging that there are problems, including high taxes on jet fuel, Dutta said there are huge opportunities going forward. ``We are in the golden age of Indian aviation and there are huge opportunities going forward... There are always problems, there are always issues and economic cycles. (But) The fundamentals are strong,`` he told PTI in an interview. According to him, tax on aviation turbine fuel (ATF) is 30 per cent higher than rest of the world. Bringing ATF under the Goods and Services Tax (GST) has been a long pending demand of the airline industry. ``Then there are throughput charges for which we should be getting credit for taxes paid,`` he added. IndiGo has been aggressively expanding its operations and has started 11 overseas routes in the last one year. Recently, it placed an order for 300 more planes from Airbus and is also considering wide-body aircraft for long haul routes. On whether there is healthy competition among local carriers, Dutta replied in the affirmative. ``We have a commonality of interests. Airlines around the world have commonality (of interests). It extends to ATF taxes, infrastructure issues. In terms of who gets which rights and who flies where, it is all fierce competition,`` he noted. He also made it clear that there are no plans for a loyalty programme for passengers. ``We have studied it. We have rejected that option... It is too expensive. We are a low cost carrier and we have to keep our costs low,`` Dutta said. When asked whether passenger volumes could balance the costs arising out of a loyalty programme, the IndiGo chief replied in the negative. ``We have the volumes already. The question is will the incremental volumes pay for it. Given the cost, the incremental volumes do not pay it,`` he noted. In September, the carrier flew 55.59 lakh passengers.
__label__society Meet the caring mum who helps brain injury survivors and is now nominated for a prestigious award Devastated mum Angela Caulfield knows what it is like to care for someone who has suffered a traumatic brain injury after her son was left fighting for his life in a horrific road traffic accident. Realising the need for extra support she set up a charity to help other survivors and she has now been shortlisted for a national award. After John's accident in 2004 Angela decided to set up the support group, which eventually became Headway County Durham, providing support for brain injury survivors and their loved ones. Fifteen years on, Angela, 54, has been nominated as Volunteer of the Year, sponsored by Anthony Gold Solicitors at the national brain injury awards ceremony. She will join just two other nominees from across the UK at a glittering ceremony organised by Headway ‚Äì the brain injury association¬†on 6 December at the InterContinental London Park Lane, Mayfair. On finding out she had been nominated, Angela, of County Durham, said: ‚ÄúI was overwhelmed, I couldn‚Äôt believe I had been nominated for the award. I remember shaking like a leaf at the time, I was just lost for words.‚Äù John was just 18 at the time of the accident when he was driving to work when he lost control of the car. The vehicle veered of the side of the road before crashing into a fence. John was left with a near-fatal brain injury, as well as numerous facial injuries. He spent a month in and out of intensive care, fighting for his life in a coma. When he woke, John had to relearn the most basic of skills, such as walking and talking. Thankfully, he was able to access specialist rehabilitation during his time in hospital. However, it was upon John‚Äôs discharge that he and his family began to realise the struggles of accessing appropriate support within the local community. Angela said: ‚ÄúJohn had incredible care and support while he was in hospital in Newcastle, but when we came home to Durham there was hardly any understanding of brain injury or access to ongoing rehab.‚Äù It was this lack of local support that drove Angela to start up a steering group which would bring together other brain injury survivors and their loved ones. Two years on from the initial meeting, Headway Durham and Chester Le Street ‚Äì later relaunched as Headway County Durham ‚Äì was formed.¬† From initially small beginnings, the charity now delivers a wide range of services across multiple sites, ensuring those affected by brain injury have the opportunity to access proper support. From weekly drop-in sessions to holistic therapies, members at Headway County Durham are able to learn new skills, meet like-minded people, and work towards the common goal of improving life after brain injury. Angela is now the Chair of the charity, and her son John is able to make use of the support and services on offer. As a way of recognising Angela‚Äôs efforts, Emma Gaudern, Trustee of Headway County Durham, nominated her for the Volunteer of the Year award. Emma said: ‚ÄúAngela works tirelessly for the benefit of those at Headway County Durham. As both a professional caregiver and mother of a son with a brain injury, it‚Äôs amazing that she still finds the time, energy and desire to help others in her time off. ‚ÄúHeadway County Durham would be lost without Angela and we count ourselves lucky to have someone with kindness, humour and experience in equal measure.‚Äù The Volunteer of the Year will be named at a glittering ceremony at the¬†InterContinental¬†hotel in Mayfair along with awards for the Achiever and Carer of the Year, and the Stephen McAleese Outstanding Contribution to Headway Award.
__label__society Hawaii remains under flash flood watch HONOLULU, Hawaii (HawaiiNewsNow) - A flash flood watch has been issued for all Hawaiian islands as two weather systems combine to increase the threat of heavy rain and thunderstorms. The National Weather Service in Honolulu said the flash flood watch will be in effect through 6 p.m. Monday. A trough of low pressure that moved in from the east will linger over the state through Monday, while an upper level disturbance moves overhead. The combination of the two will produce very unstable conditions that could produce heavy rain and flash flooding. Kauai has already seen an extended period of heavy rain since Saturday night, and was under a flash flood warning from Saturday night through early Sunday afternoon, when the warning was finally canceled. A flash flood watch means that conditions are favorable for flash flooding to occur. Monitor the forecasts and be prepared to take action if a flash flood warning is issued. Do not try to cross fast-flowing water in your vehicle or on foot. This story will be updated. Copyright 2019 Hawaii News Now. All rights reserved.
__label__society 7 lose jobs after Popeyes brawl caught on camera (WITI) - Seven Popeyes employees were fired after a brawl at a Milwaukee restaurant was caught on camera. Richard Fourte¬†went inside the Popeyes Wednesday night to avoid the drive-thru lane. He noticed a lot of employees working there before things became heated.¬† Fourte¬†heard someone yell, ``It's a fight!`` before they ran back to the grills. Then, he said, ``two guys start fighting again.`` He started recording with his cellphone as a violent fight broke out, with chairs flying and several employees throwing punches. ``It was just out of control,`` Fourte said. ``That was the first thing that went through my head, like this is out of control.`` He can be heard on the video telling them to break it up soon. After the situation cooled off, Fourte left the restaurant empty-handed. ``Honestly, I wasn't even going to get the chicken sandwich, you know,`` Fourte said.¬† Popeyes franchise owner John Broderson released the following statement to Fox6: ``This was an unfortunate, isolated incident which we take very seriously. The dining room was closed immediately after the altercation at 9:30pm. As a result of this, 7 employees were terminated from the Company, including the manager on duty.`` Milwaukee police responded to the scene, but no arrests were made. It is still unclear what sparked the fight.
__label__sport –®–∞—Ä–ª—å –õ–µ–∫–ª–µ—Ä: –ó–∞–¥–∞—á–∞ –Ω–∞ –≥–æ–Ω–∫—É –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–∞—è –®–∞—Ä–ª—å –õ–µ–∫–ª–µ—Ä –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—Å—è –Ω–µ–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª–µ–Ω —Å–æ–±–æ–π –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –Ω–µ—É–¥–∞—á–Ω–æ–π –±—ã —è –≤–∑—è–ª –ø–æ—É–ª, —ç—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –±—ã –ª—É—á—à–µ –¥–ª—è –≤—Å–µ—Ö. –í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å: –í –ª—é–±–æ–º —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à–µ–π –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–µ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å, –∏ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥! –ú–Ω–µ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –Ω–∞–¥–æ –±—ã —Ç–∞–∫ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–∞—è, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞ –≥–æ–Ω–æ—á–Ω—ã–π —Ç–µ–º–ø –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç –∂–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –ª—É—á—à–µ–≥–æ, –Ω–æ —è —Å–æ–±–∏—Ä–∞—é—Å—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –≤—ã–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å—Å—è ‚Äì –Ω–∞–¥–µ—é—Å—å, —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –¥–æ –ø–æ–¥–∏—É–º–∞. –í –ª—é–±–æ–º —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ, —è –Ω–∞–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—å —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ! –í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å: –ö–∞–∫—É—é —Ç–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –≤ –≥–æ–Ω–∫–µ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç—å —ç—Ç—É –∑–∞–¥–∞—á—É?–®–∞—Ä–ª—å –õ–µ–∫–ª–µ—Ä: –ü–æ–∫–∞ –Ω–µ –∑–Ω–∞—é, –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞ –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º, –Ω–æ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º—ã —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç—É–µ–º –Ω–∞ —à–∏–Ω–∞—Ö —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–π –∂—ë—Å—Ç–∫–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –Ω–µ –¥—É–º–∞—é, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–∏—Ç –∫–∞–∫–æ–µ-—Ç–æ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ. –ù–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–π —Ç—Ä–∞—Å—Å–µ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–∏—Ü–∞ –º–µ–∂–¥—É —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞–º–∏ Soft –∏ Medium –≤ –ø–ª–∞–Ω–µ –¥–µ–≥—Ä–∞–¥–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–µ–≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–∞, –Ω–æ –º—ã –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞–µ–º—Å—è —á—Ç–æ-–Ω–∏–±—É–¥—å –ø—Ä–∏–¥—É–º–∞—Ç—å. –í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å: –ö–∞–∫–æ–π —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –≤—ã —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–µ—Ç–µ –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–º, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –¥–æ–±–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —É—Å–ø–µ—Ö–∞ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–π —Ç—Ä–∞—Å—Å–µ –≤ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è—Ö —Å—É—Ö–æ–π –ø–æ–≥–æ–¥—ã, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –≤–æ—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Å–µ–Ω—å–µ?–®–∞—Ä–ª—å –õ–µ–∫–ª–µ—Ä: –û–¥–Ω–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–Ω–æ, –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –≤–∞–∂–µ–Ω —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π —Ç–µ–º–ø. –í –û—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–µ –æ–Ω –±—ã–ª –Ω–µ–≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–π, –∏ –Ω–∞–¥ –≥–æ–Ω–æ—á–Ω—ã–º —Ç–µ–º–ø–æ–º –Ω–∞–º –µ—â—ë –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ–π —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–µ –º—ã —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –µ–∑–¥–∏–ª–∏ —Å –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–π —Ç–æ–ø–ª–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–æ–π, —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏–ª–æ –∫–æ–µ-—á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å ‚Äì –Ω–∞–¥–µ—é—Å—å, –º—ã —Å–º–æ–∂–µ–º –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –æ–ø—ã—Ç –ø–æ —Ö–æ–¥—É –≥–æ–Ω–∫–∏. –í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å: –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, –≤–∞—à–∞ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞ –±—ã–ª–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ–º —Å–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–µ, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –Ω–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º ‚Äì –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç –ª–∏ —ç—Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –≤ –≤–æ—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Å–µ–Ω—å–µ –≤ –≤–∞—à–µ–º –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –º—ã —É–≤–∏–¥–∏–º –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–≥–æ–Ω–æ–≤?–®–∞—Ä–ª—å –õ–µ–∫–ª–µ—Ä: –ï—Å–ª–∏ —á–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ, –≤ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–π –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–µ –≤ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª–µ —è –∏ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π —Å–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –ø—Ä–æ–µ—Ö–∞–ª –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–æ, —ç—Ç–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–∞ –±—ã–ª–∞ –Ω–µ—É–¥–∞—á–Ω–æ–π. –ù–æ –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ-—Ç–æ –æ–±–≥–æ–Ω—ã, –Ω–∞–¥–µ—é—Å—å, —É–≤–∏–¥–∏—Ç–µ!
__label__sport –§–∏–≥—É—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—ã –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä–∞ –ë–æ–π–∫–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äì –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –ö–æ–∑–ª–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π –≤—ã–∏–≥—Ä–∞–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–∞–ø –ì—Ä–∞–Ω-–ø—Ä–∏ –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–µ –≤ –ø–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–º –∫–∞—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –î–≤–µ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–∞—Ä—ã –∑–∞–≤–æ–µ–≤–∞–ª–∏ –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–æ –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä–æ –Ω–∞ –ø—è—Ç–æ–º —ç—Ç–∞–ø–µ –ì—Ä–∞–Ω-–ø—Ä–∏ –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–µ. –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä–∞ –ë–æ–π–∫–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äì –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –ö–æ–∑–ª–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π –æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–ª–∏ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –ø–æ–±–µ–¥—É –≤ —Å–µ—Ä–∏–∏, –ï–≤–≥–µ–Ω–∏—è –¢–∞—Ä–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äì –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ú–æ—Ä–æ–∑–æ–≤ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä—è–Ω—ã–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏. –ë—Ä–æ–Ω–∑–∞ —É –Ω–µ–º–µ—Ü–∫–æ–π –ø–∞—Ä—ã –ú–∏–Ω–µ—Ä–≤–∞ –§–∞–±–∏–µ–Ω–Ω–µ –•–∞–∑–µ ‚Äì –ù–æ–ª–∞–Ω –ó–∏–≥–µ—Ä—Ç. –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è–Ω–µ –ö—Å–µ–Ω–∏—è –°—Ç–æ–ª–±–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äì –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –ù–æ–≤–æ—Å–µ–ª–æ–≤ –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–∏–ª–∏ —Å–æ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ 5-–º –º–µ—Å—Ç–µ, —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å-—Å–ª—É–∂–±–∞ –§–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–∞—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—å–∫–∞—Ö –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ (–§–§–ö–ö–†). –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä–∞ –ë–æ–π–∫–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äì –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –ö–æ–∑–ª–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π –≤–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –≤ –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä–µ –æ—Ç–æ–±—Ä–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤–æ –≤–∑—Ä–æ—Å–ª—ã–π —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª –ì—Ä–∞–Ω-–ø—Ä–∏, –≤—ã–∏–≥—Ä–∞–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–∞–ø—ã –≤ –ö–∞–Ω–∞–¥–µ –∏ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –§–∏–≥—É—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—ã –∏–∑ –ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥–∞ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ –Ω–∞ –º–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º –ª—å–¥—É —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∏ –≤—Å–µ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã: –ø–∞—Ä–∞–ª–ª–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π 3-–π —Å–∞–ª—å—Ö–æ–≤, –∫–∞—Å–∫–∞–¥ 3-–π —Ç—É–ª—É–ø + 2-–π —Ç—É–ª—É–ø + 2-–π —Ç—É–ª—É–ø, –ø–æ–¥–∫—Ä—É—Ç 4-–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è, –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∏ 4-–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è, –≤—ã–±—Ä–æ—Å—ã 3-–π —Ñ–ª–∏–ø –∏ 3-–π —Ä–∏—Ç–±–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ä, –≤—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏—è 3-–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è –∏ —Ç–æ–¥–µ—Å 2-–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è. –ù–∞ –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å-–∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –ö–æ–∑–ª–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–æ –µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–∫–∞—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π. ``–ù–∞—á–Ω—É —Å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–π –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏. –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤—á–µ—Ä–∞ –º—ã –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–ª–∏—Å—å —Å —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∏, —Ç–æ –°–∞—à–µ –Ω–∞ —Ç–µ–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω –ø—Ä–∏—à–ª–æ —É–≤–µ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ –≤–∏–¥–µ–æ —Å —é—Ç—É–±–∞ –ø–æ–¥ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º ``–¶–∞—Ä—è –°–∞–º–∞—Ä–∏–Ω–∞ –≤—á–µ—Ä–∞ –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å–º–æ–≥ –ø–æ–±–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å``. –ü–æ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫—É –º—ã –ø—Ä–æ–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ–º –≤ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–∏—Ü–µ –≤ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–µ —Å –°–∞—à–µ–π –°–∞–º–∞—Ä–∏–Ω—ã–º, —Ç–æ —è –ø–æ–¥—É–º–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω —á—Ç–æ –ª–∏ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –µ–º—É... –ê –µ—Å–ª–∏ –æ—Ç–±—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å —à—É—Ç–∫–∏, —Ç–æ –º—ã –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ä–∞–¥—ã, —á—Ç–æ –≤–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –æ—Ç–æ–±—Ä–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤–æ –≤–∑—Ä–æ—Å–ª—ã–π —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª –ì—Ä–∞–Ω-–ø—Ä–∏, –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª–∏ —Å–µ–±–µ –ø—É—Ç–µ–≤–∫—É. –†–∞–Ω–µ–µ —è –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ —É –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö —ç—Ç–∞–ø–æ–≤, –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –ª–µ–≥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–æ–ø–µ—Ä–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∏ –º—ã —Ä–∞–¥—ã, —á—Ç–æ –≤ –∫–∞–∫–æ–º-—Ç–æ —Å–º—ã—Å–ª–µ –ø—Ä–µ–æ–¥–æ–ª–µ–ª–∏ —Å–µ–±—è``, -- —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π. –ï–≤–≥–µ–Ω–∏—è –¢–∞—Ä–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äì –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ú–æ—Ä–æ–∑–æ–≤, –∫ —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –Ω–µ —Å–º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –∏–∑–±–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π. –í–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –ø–∞—Ä–∞–ª–ª–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ 3-–≥–æ —Å–∞–ª—å—Ö–æ–≤–∞ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∏ –¥–≤–æ–π–Ω–æ–π, –Ω–∞ –∫–∞—Å–∫–∞–¥–µ –∏–∑ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö —Ç—É–ª—É–ø–æ–≤ ‚Äì —Ç—Ä–æ–π–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏ –¥–≤—É—Ö –¥–≤–æ–π–Ω—ã—Ö –±—ã–ª –Ω–µ–¥–æ–∫—Ä—É—Ç. –§–∏–≥—É—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–º –Ω–µ —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–∞–≤–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å —É–ø—É—â–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –±–∞–ª–ª–æ–≤ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º—ã. –ò —Ö–æ—Ç—è –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω—É—é –æ–Ω–∏ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∏ —Å–≤–æ–π ``—Å–∏–∑–Ω –±–µ—Å—Ç``, –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∏–ª–æ –¥–æ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞. ``–ë—ã–ª–æ –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–æ. –ï—Å—Ç—å –Ω–∞–¥ —á–µ–º —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å. –£ –Ω–∞—Å –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ —Ü–µ–ª–∏, —Å–≤–æ–∏ –ø–ª–∞–Ω—ã. –ú—ã –∏–¥–µ–º —Å–≤–æ–∏–º –ø—É—Ç–µ–º. –ú—ã –Ω–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—Å—è. –í–∏–¥–∏–º —Å–≤–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å. –≠—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –ª—É—á—à–µ, —á–µ–º —Ä–∞–Ω—å—à–µ. –ò–¥–µ–º –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ ‚Äì —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ–º``, -- –ø—Ä–æ–∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ú–æ—Ä–æ–∑–æ–≤. –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –≤ –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä–µ —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç –ö—Å–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –°—Ç–æ–ª–±–æ–≤–æ–π –∏ –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ—è –ù–æ–≤–æ—Å–µ–ª–æ–≤–∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–µ—Å —É–¥–æ–≤–ª–µ—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Å–º–µ–Ω–∞–º. –§–∏–≥—É—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—ã –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—å —Å –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–æ–π, –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω—É—é –∏—Ö –ø–æ–∫–∞ –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∏–ª–æ. –ë—ã–ª–∏ –ø–æ–º–∞—Ä–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä—ã–∂–∫–∞—Ö, –≤—ã–±—Ä–æ—Å–µ –∏ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞—Ö. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –ö—Å–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ, –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –æ–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –Ω–∞ –ø—è—Ç–æ–µ –∏ –≤ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–µ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏ –ø—è—Ç—ã–º–∏. –°–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Å–º–µ–Ω—ã –≤–æ–∑–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –æ—Ç –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–µ–≤, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —á—Ç–æ-–ª–∏–±–æ —Ä–∞–Ω–æ.
__label__technology 2020 Hyundai Creta vs Current-Gen Creta ‚Äì Specs, Features and Design Comparison The arrival of Hyundai‚Äôs sister brand Kia in the Indian market has made life tougher for the former‚Äôs mid-size SUV, the Creta. The Seltos has dethroned the Creta as the best-selling mid-size SUV, and the Hyundai SUV is in dire need of a new-gen model to get back on its feet and go head to head against its cousin. We have already seen the upcoming Creta, which was recently launched by Hyundai in China as the ix25. Although, we will have to wait till February next year as Hyundai will likely be unveiling the 2020 Creta at the said event first, followed by the launch at a later date. Would the upcoming second-gen Creta be able to fill the current model‚Äôs shoes in the Indian market? Let‚Äôs compare the two to find out. Dimension wise, the upcoming Creta will only be slightly larger than the outgoing model ‚Äì it will be 30 mm longer, 10 mm wider, have a 20 mm longer wheelbase, yet will be 43 mm shorter than the current-gen model. Take a look at the dimensions of the two in detail ‚Äì The 2020 Hyundai Creta is set to receive a major overhaul in terms of design, as compared to the current model on sale. Since the launch of the first-gen model, the Creta has attracted a majority of people with its bold and boxy looks. However, Hyundai has played safe while designing the Creta until now and did not include anything out of the box. However, things are set to change with the upcoming Creta. Hyundai has ditched the conventional design for a rather funky look. The ix25 SUV is made keeping in mind Hyundai‚Äôs ‚ÄòSensuous Sportiness‚Äô styling statement, hence it sports the brand‚Äôs signature cascading grille at the front, with split LED headlamps, similar to the ones seen on the Venue. The overall silhouette of the first-gen Creta is retained, which gives both the models a similar side profile, apart from new alloy wheels of course. At the rear, the 2020 Creta will feature a similar split setup for the LED tail lamps, just like the front. The boot lid will also feature horizontal slat, which will house the brake light. Hyundai has always been known to up the ante in terms of tech on offer every time it launches a new product. The current-gen Creta already comes with a plethora of features, which include a 7-inch touchscreen infotainment system with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, smart key connectivity, an electric sunroof, front ventilated seats, a wireless phone charger, cruise control among others. However, the next-gen Hyundai Creta is definitely going to set many benchmarks for future mid-size SUVs to come. Inside the cabin, the Hyundai ix25 features a large vertically stacked touchscreen infotainment system which also doubles up as the HVAC controller. The China-spec Creta also gets a panoramic sunroof, and if it makes it to India, it will be a first-in-segment offering. The car is also likely to get a fully-digital MID, a 360-degree camera along with multiple driving modes over the current-gen model. Currently, Hyundai offers the Creta with one petrol engine and two diesel powertrains. The petrol engine is a 1.6-litre unit that produces 121 HP of peak power and 151 Nm of peak torque. The smaller 1.4-litre diesel engine is rated at 89 HP power and 220 Nm torque, whereas the more powerful 1.6-litre diesel unit makes 126 HP/265 Nm. All three engines on offer are currently BS4 compliant. The 2020 Hyundai Creta will get BS6 compliant engines since day one, and the car will be sharing its platform with its cousin, the Kia Seltos. Hence, it will be offered with Seltos‚Äô 1.5-litre petrol and diesel engines. Both the engines make an identical maximum power of 113 HP, but the petrol unit has a peak torque output of 144 Nm, while the diesel engine churns out 250 Nm. The Seltos is also offered with a 1.4-litre turbocharged petrol unit with the sportier and more premium GT Line variants. The said engine puts out 138 HP power and 242 Nm torque and might be introduced by Hyundai as an ‚ÄòN‚Äô Line variant with the 2020 Creta in India. The upcoming Creta, in short, will have a more dynamic exterior and premium interior stuffed with modern technologies and the engine lineup is also noteworthily brand new.
__label__other Kate Beckinsale Shuts Down Jamie Foxx Dating Rumors According to a report from PageSix.com, Kate Beckinsale recently came out to address the claims of a relationship between her and Jamie Foxx. On her IG account, the 46-year-old Underworld alum addressed the social media rumors that she and the 51-year-old Oscar-winner were an item. Reportedly, a photograph of Kate and Jamie together at the Hollywood Reporter Golden Globe after party went viral. In the picture, Foxx is featured hugging Beckinsale closely to his body along with his hand on her lower back. On her account, Beckinsale stated that just because she stood beside him, it doesn‚Äôt mean they were in a relationship. Beckinsale joked on her account that she was at the dry cleaners at the time of her post and if that principle held true, that means she‚Äôs in a relationship with a lot of people. As it was previously reported, Beckinsale recently finished the divorce proceedings between herself and ex-husband, Len Wiseman, after four years of being apart. Kate found herself in the spotlight once again when she started dating Pete Davidson, from Saturday Night Live. It comes at a particular time for Foxx, who just separated from Katie Holmes after six years of dating, in August. Since then, people online became entirely convinced that he was dating the young singer, Sela Vave. Foxx claimed he was merely helping her with her career. As it was noted above, Kate and Pete stirred up controversy earlier this year when they were spotted hanging out on a number of occasions. It came shortly after Pete and Ariana called off their engagement, which was in the headlines for months. Addressing the media frenzy that came as a consequence of her relationship with Pete, Kate stated she was honestly surprised the public and the media became so interested in it. Additionally, some people online weren‚Äôt happy with the age difference between them. During an episode of Saturday Night Live, Davidson fought back against social media critics as well when he referenced the litany of actors who dated much younger women ‚Äì clearly, in defense of Kate.

–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–∏, –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–æ—à–µ–ª –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏–∫–∏. –ü—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω—ã –≤—ã—è—Å–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è. –≠—Ç–æ [–±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∞–ø–ø–∞—Ä–∞—Ç] ‚Äû–û—Ä–∏–æ–Ω‚Äú¬ª, ‚Äî —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –¢–ê–°–°¬†—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å –ø–æ –æ—Å–æ–±–æ –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–º –¥–µ–ª–∞–º –ú–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –º–µ–∂—Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –°–£ –°–ö –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–µ –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –ë—É–±–µ–Ω–µ–≤. –ü–æ –µ–≥–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º, –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã —É –±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –µ—â–µ –¥–æ –ø–æ—Å–∞–¥–∫–∏. ¬´–ü–æ–≥–æ–¥–∞ –≤—Ä—è–¥ –ª–∏ –º–æ–≥–ª–∞ –ø–æ–≤–ª–∏—è—Ç—å, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ, –±–æ–∫–æ–≤–æ–π –≤–µ—Ç–µ—Ä¬ª, ‚Äî —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –æ–Ω. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∏–ª–∞ –≥–ª–∞–≤–∞ –†—è–∑–∞–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω–∞ –ù–∞—Ç–∞–ª—å—è –ñ—É–Ω—è–µ–≤–∞, –±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ —É–ø–∞–ª –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ –≤ 70-—Ç–∏ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö –æ—Ç –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–∫–≤–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∂–∏–ª–æ–≥–æ –¥–æ–º–∞. –ü–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∞–≤—à–∏—Ö –Ω–µ—Ç. ¬´–û—Ä–∏–æ–Ω¬ª ‚Äî —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤—ã—Å–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–π –±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–ª–µ—Ç–∞. –ù–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ä—É–º–µ ¬´–ê—Ä–º–∏—è-2018¬ª –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–∞ ¬´–ö—Ä–æ–Ω—à—Ç–∞–¥—Ç¬ª –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –±–ª–æ–∫ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤–æ–æ—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –¥–ª—è –±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ—Ç–∏–ø –±–æ–µ–ø—Ä–∏–ø–∞—Å–∞ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –º–∞—Å—Å–æ–π –¥–æ 50 –∫–≥, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –æ—Å–Ω–∞—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–º–∏ –±–æ–µ–≤—ã–º–∏ —á–∞—Å—Ç—è–º–∏. –ù–∞ –∞–≤–∏–∞—Å–∞–ª–æ–Ω–µ ¬´–ú–ê–ö–°-2019¬ª –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã ¬´–ö—Ä–æ–Ω—à—Ç–∞–¥—Ç¬ª –ù–∏–∫–æ–ª–∞–π –î–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω–∫–æ–≤ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ ¬´–û—Ä–∏–æ–Ω¬ª –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç–∞–¥–∏–∏ –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–π, –ú–∏–Ω–æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç –æ–¥–∏–Ω —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å –¥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–∞ –≥–æ–¥–∞.
__label__other UNLV‚Äôs Robert Smith fighting to recover from massive stroke His eyes are open now and he no longer needs a machine to breathe. His movements, even something as uncomplicated as scratching a leg, are incredibly laborious but purposeful. And when you call his name and he looks at you and his arm shakes and frustration settles across that gentle and kind and familiar face, you just know. Robert Smith is in there and, by God, he‚Äôs fighting like hell to come back. There is a saying for those who have suffered a stroke, especially the massive kind that struck one of the greatest point guards in UNLV basketball history last month, about not having to see the whole staircase when it comes to one‚Äôs path to recovery. Just take the first step, is all. Smith has certainly done that, and yet in no way does such a flicker of positive light lessen that which is so infuriating: That in a final examination of why terrible things happen to the best among us, it‚Äôs pointless to judge the universe. ‚ÄúI just know you have to believe that somewhere out there, and I know this is going to sound somewhat metaphysical, there is a recognition of what a truly good person is,‚Äù said Jon Sandler, UNLV‚Äôs radio play-by-play voice who called games with Smith the past 10 years. ‚ÄúThe fact Robert is such a genuinely good person has to count for something. We‚Äôre hoping all of that leads to him coming back from what has been a terrible, terrible setback. ‚ÄúI miss my friend.‚Äù The TV hanging from a wall inside a room at a long-term care facility in Las Vegas on Wednesday was turned to ‚Äî what else? ‚Äî basketball. Smith was propped up in bed, his eyes open and darting about, still being fed through a tube, family members and an attending nurse speaking about progress made the last several weeks. The fact he is breathing on his own is beyond significant. Now, the long journey back really begins. It‚Äôs one of the more exasperating truths about some stroke recoveries, awaking to others speaking a language you might not understand. Or when you try to talk, the wrong words come out. Or, in the case with Smith at this point, you can‚Äôt speak at all. There is an invisible wall between you and the world, and no matter how much you fight internally to remove it, you remain prisoner to an existence of thorough aggravation. And yet such truth is far better than those days immediately following Smith‚Äôs stroke, when doctors sat family members down and intimated that should things not improve over a set timeline, difficult decisions would have to be made about a man who was in a comatose state and on a medical ventilator. ‚ÄúNo matter what the doctors said or how bad it looked, we knew he could come back from this because we know the man,‚Äù said Future Smith, Robert‚Äôs daughter-in-law and married to Jamaal Smith, who plays basketball professionally in Brazil. ‚ÄúI know this sounds crazy, but when I was in the room with him those first few weeks after it happened, that‚Äôs when I felt most at peace and absolutely sure he would eventually be OK. He‚Äôs a fighter like nobody I know. ‚ÄúJamaal just sat there telling him, ‚ÄòDad, we‚Äôre here fighting for you. You keep fighting.‚Äô The body and brain need time to heal, and they will. Like everything in his life, Robert won‚Äôt ever give up.‚Äù He is 64 and never has. Smith wasn‚Äôt recruited much out of Crenshaw High in Los Angeles, so he enrolled at Arizona Western Community College in 1973, after which his coach convinced Jerry Tarkanian at UNLV to take a chance on a second-team all-conference point guard. The smile is what Tarkanian would later say stuck with him most. Few have a better, more infectious one than Smith. He would play three seasons for the Rebels, direct them to their first Final Four in 1977 as a member of the ‚ÄúHardway Eight‚Äù and become the school‚Äôs all-time leader in free-throw percentage and ninth in assists. He then departed for a pro career that included seven NBA seasons and playing time overseas. Forgive me if you have read or heard my numerous rants on the subject, but the fact that Smith‚Äôs jersey isn‚Äôt retired and hanging from the rafters at the Thomas & Mack Center is a bigger joke than anything you‚Äôll hear at a comedy club on the Strip. ‚ÄúHe was our leader on and off the court,‚Äù said ‚ÄúSudden‚Äù Sam Smith, teammate to Robert at UNLV and having coached Las Vegas youth alongside him for years. ‚ÄúHe did everything perfect. Man, when we were on the road, we‚Äôd always have to wait for Tark to fall asleep so we could sneak out and get into stuff. But not Robert. He would just say, ‚ÄòGuys, don‚Äôt stay out too late, and when you‚Äôre ready to come back, call me and I will open up the door for you.‚Äô ‚ÄúNo player was ever more respected by his teammates. There he was, praying before every game. Kept everyone in line. Robert taught me how to be a better man and a loving husband. No one is more loyal on this earth. Why would this happen to Robert Smith? I don‚Äôt know. I know some things are out of our hands. But if being the best person in the world counts for anything, he will make his way back to us.‚Äù When the mysterious and cruel parts of fate rain, they can also downright pour. Gloria Smith, Robert‚Äôs wife, recently underwent surgery for breast cancer, which Future Smith called a success this past week and said follow-up radiation and chemotherapy treatments would commence soon. But the bills for Robert and Gloria have piled up in a monumental manner, causing the family to open a GoFundMe account and arrange fundraisers to help with medical costs. I wanted more than anything else to see that smile again Wednesday, standing beside Sandler as he recounted to Smith details of UNLV‚Äôs game at California the previous evening. ‚ÄúOne of the most heartbreaking things is you‚Äôre not really sure he‚Äôs hearing you, but you hope,‚Äù Sandler said. ‚ÄúRobert is a part of the fabric of the UNLV program. I wish he was around for what I think is a very promising future. He, as much as anyone, deserves to be part of whatever success and promise the program delivers.‚Äù The basketball highlights played on a TV above as Sandler spoke about what was an overtime loss for the Rebels in Berkeley. And in that instant, Robert Smith‚Äôs eyes darted and his arm shook. We know you‚Äôre in there, friend. Fight like hell. Fight all the way back. Search GoFundMe and Robert Smith/UNLV online to donate. There is a fundraiser at Born And Raised, 7260 S. Cimarron Road, on Dec. 3 from 6 to 8 p.m.
__label__economy ¬´–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º-–º–µ–¥–∏–∞¬ª –∑–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–ª —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –±—Ä–µ–Ω–¥ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∫–æ–≤ Starvit –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω –Ω–∞ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –•–æ–ª–¥–∏–Ω–≥ ¬´–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º-–º–µ–¥–∏–∞¬ª (–ù–¢–í, –¢–ù–¢, ¬´–ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∏–æ¬ª –∏ –¥—Ä.) –∑–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–ª –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∞ ‚Äî —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∫–∏ –ø–æ–¥ –±—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–º Starvit. –û–± —ç—Ç–æ–º –ø–∏—à–µ—Ç –≥–∞–∑–µ—Ç–∞ ¬´–ö–æ–º–º–µ—Ä—Å–∞–Ω—Ç—ä¬ª. –†–µ—á—å –∏–¥–µ—Ç –æ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º—ã—Ö —Ç–∞–±–ª–µ—Ç–∫–∞—Ö Starvit Vitamin Energy, —Å—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –∫–æ—Ñ–µ–∏–Ω, —Ç–µ–∞–Ω–∏–Ω, —ç–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ç –∫–æ—Ä–Ω—è –∂–µ–Ω—å—à–µ–Ω—è –∏ –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–∏–π –ª–∏–º–æ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫. –ü—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –∫–∞–∫ ¬´–≤–∏—Ç–∞–º–∏–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–∫—Ç–µ–π–ª—å¬ª –∏ ¬´–Ω–∞—Ç—É—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å—Ç–∏–º—É–ª—è—Ç–æ—Ä¬ª. Starvit —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ—Ç –∑–æ–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ã–º –±—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–º, –ø–æ–¥ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–º –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è ¬´–ª–∏–Ω–µ–π–∫–∞ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∫–æ–≤¬ª, –ø–æ–¥—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–¥–∏–ª–∏ –∏–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—é –≤ ¬´–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º-–º–µ–¥–∏–∞¬ª. –¶–µ–ª–µ–≤–∞—è –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è ‚Äî –∂–∏–≤—É—â–∏–µ –≤ –º–µ–≥–∞–ø–æ–ª–∏—Å–∞—Ö –º–æ–ª–æ–¥—ã–µ –ª—é–¥–∏ –≤ –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ 20‚Äì40 –ª–µ—Ç, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã–∫–ª–∏ –∫ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-–ø–æ–∫—É–ø–∫–∞–º, —É—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–ª–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏. –û–Ω —É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–≤–∏–≥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–π —Å –±–ª–æ–≥–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏. –ì–µ–Ω–¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –û–û–û ¬´–°—Ç–∞—Ä–≤–∏—Ç¬ª —Å—Ç–∞–ª –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä –°–∞–º–±–æ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π (—Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –û–û–û ¬´–¢–ù–¢-–†–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω¬ª). Starvit ‚Äî –Ω–µ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç ¬´–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º-–º–µ–¥–∏–∞¬ª. –í –∞–≤–≥—É—Å—Ç–µ —Ö–æ–ª–¥–∏–Ω–≥ —Å—Ç–∞–ª —Å–æ—É—á—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–º —Å –¥–æ–ª–µ–π 50% –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ø–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ —Å–æ –∑–≤–µ–∑–¥–∞–º–∏ BubelMGT, –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü–µ–π —à–æ—É ¬´–•–æ–ª–æ—Å—Ç—è–∫¬ª –Ω–∞ –¢–ù–¢ –î—É—Å–µ–π –ë—É–±–µ–ª—å. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ —Ö–æ–ª–¥–∏–Ω–≥ –∑–∞ –Ω–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª –≤ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç–∞–ø Native Rent –ø–æ –ø–∞–∫–µ—Ç–Ω–æ–º—É —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏—é –Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π —Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–º—ã, –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ —Å –±–ª–æ–≥–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏ Happy Monday Family, –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è –¥–µ—Ç—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä–æ–≤ Nappy Club, –∞–≥—Ä–µ–≥–∞—Ç–æ—Ä –∫–µ–π—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ Catery Catery.

—Ç–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å—É—Ç–æ–∫ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥—É–µ—Ç —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—é –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ —Å–∏–ª–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–ª–∏ —É–º—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∏, –Ω–æ –∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤. –ù–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—è —Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –¥—ã—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –Ω–∞ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∏—Ö –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–æ–≤. –¢–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ –¥–∞–∂–µ –µ—Å–ª–∏ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Ü–µ–ª—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å –ª–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –¥–∏–≤–∞–Ω–µ –≤ —Ç–µ–ø–ª–æ–π –∫–æ–º–Ω–∞—Ç–µ, –µ–≥–æ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –∏ —Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å —Å–∏–ª—ã. –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã —É–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å, —Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∫–∞–ª–æ—Ä–∏–π –≤—ã —Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç–µ —Ç–∞–∫–∏–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–º, –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—åBMR (–±–∞–∑–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–µ—Ç–∞–±–æ–ª–∏–∑–º–∞). –í —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–º –º—É–∂—á–∏–Ω—ã –≤ –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ 30-39 –ª–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏ –≤–µ—Å–µ 70 –∫–≥ —Ç—Ä–∞—Ç—è—Ç –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–π –æ–±–º–µ–Ω 1650 –ö–∫–∞–ª, –∞ –∂–µ–Ω—â–∏–Ω—ã —Ç–æ–≥–æ –∂–µ –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–∏ –≤–µ—Å–µ 55 –∫–≥ ‚Äì 1260 –ö–∫–∞–ª. –§–ò–ó–ò–ß–ï–°–ö–ê–Ø –†–ê–ë–û–¢–ê. –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫ –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é, –µ–≥–æ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–æ–∑–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç—ã –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∞—é—Ç. –ò, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤—ã—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å, –∫–∞–∫–æ–µ –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ –æ–Ω —Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç –∑–∞ –¥–µ–Ω—å, –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–∏—Ç—å AMR (–∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –º–µ—Ç–∞–±–æ–ª–∏–∑–º), —Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å —É–º–Ω–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–º–µ–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—ç—Ñ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–µ–Ω—Ç, —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ. –ú–µ–Ω—å—à–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ —Ç–µ–º, –∫—Ç–æ –≤–µ–¥–µ—Ç —Å–∏–¥—è—á–∏–π –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ (–∫–æ—ç—Ñ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–µ–Ω—Ç ‚Äì 1,2). –ü—Ä–∏ —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–π –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∞—Ö –æ—Ç 3 –¥–æ 5 —Ä–∞–∑ –≤ –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—é –∫–æ—ç—Ñ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–µ–Ω—Ç –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –¥–æ 1,55, –∞ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Å–º–µ–Ω–æ–≤ ‚Äì –¥–æ 1,9. –ü–û–ß–ï–ú–£ –ú–´ –ù–ï –õ–Æ–ë–ò–ú –î–£–ú–ê–¢–¨? –í —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–º –≤ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–µ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –º—ã—à—Ü—ã –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è 35-45% –æ—Ç –æ–±—â–µ–π –º–∞—Å—Å—ã —Ç–µ–ª–∞, –∞ –Ω–∞ –º–æ–∑–≥ ‚Äì –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ 2%. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –æ–Ω —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç –∫–æ–ª–æ—Å—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–æ–≤. –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –°–ê–í–ï–õ–¨–ï–í, –¥–æ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –±–∏–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–∞—É–∫: –í —Ç–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–æ–ª–≥–∏—Ö –≤–µ–∫–æ–≤ —ç–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º –ø—Ä–∏—Å–ø–æ—Å–∞–±–ª–∏–≤–∞–ª—Å—è —ç–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏—Ç—å —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å—ã, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ —É –ª—é–¥–µ–π –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω–∏ —Å–º–æ–≥—É—Ç –¥–æ–±—ã—Ç—å —Å–µ–±–µ –ø–∏—â—É –Ω–∞ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π –¥–µ–Ω—å. –°–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫ —Ä–µ–¥–∫–æ –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç –æ—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–∫ –≤ –µ–¥–µ, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–µ –≤–∏–¥–∏—Ç —Å–º—ã—Å–ª–∞ –≤ —ç–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏–∏ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏. –ù–æ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–∫–∞ ¬´—ç–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏—Ç—å¬ª –∑–∞–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∞ –≤ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –≥–µ–Ω–æ–≤ –∏ —Ä–µ—Ñ–ª–µ–∫—Å–æ–≤. –ö–ê–ö –†–ê–ë–û–¢–ê–ï–¢ –ú–û–ó–ì? –í—Ä–∞—á-–ø—Å–∏—Ö–∏–∞—Ç—Ä –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –ö—É—Ä–ø–∞—Ç–æ–≤–æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω—è–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –º–æ–∑–≥ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ —Å —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –∞ —Å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º–∏ –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏. –û–Ω –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ—Ç —Å–∏–≥–Ω–∞–ª—ã –∏–∑–≤–Ω–µ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ã —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω—ã —Ç–∞–∫, —á—Ç–æ –≤ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ª–∏–±–æ –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é, –ª–∏–±–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –µ–µ –º–æ–∑–≥—É. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ã —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤ –Ω–∞ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è ¬´–æ—Ç–∫–ª—é—á–∞—é—Ç—Å—è¬ª, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—Ç—å –º–æ–∑–≥—É —Å–∏–≥–Ω–∞–ª. –í —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–µ –º–æ–∑–≥ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–∏—Å—Ç—ã–µ —Å–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ ¬´–≤–∏–¥–∏—Ç¬ª –Ω–µ –≤–µ—Å—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å, –∞ –µ–≥–æ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã. –ó–∞—Ç–µ–º –µ–º—É –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—É—é –∏ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–æ–∑–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω—É—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É ‚Äì —Ä–µ–∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Ñ—Ä–∞–≥–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º. –≠—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Å —Ç–µ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –º—ã —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º –∫–∏–Ω–æ: –ª–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–æ–∫, –Ω–æ –º—ã –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ–º –∏—Ö –∫–∞–∫ –ø–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –ö–ê–ö –í–û–°–°–¢–ê–ù–û–í–ò–¢–¨–°–Ø –ü–û–°–õ–ï –ù–ê–ì–†–£–ó–ö–ò? –°–æ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –º–æ–∑–≥–∞ –º—ã –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂–µ–º: –æ–Ω –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–µ—Ç —Ç—Ä—É–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –¥–∞–∂–µ –≤–æ —Å–Ω–µ ‚Äì –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é –∑–∞ –¥–µ–Ω—å –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é –∏ —Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –ø–æ–ª—É—à–∞—Ä–∏–π. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ª—É—á—à–∏–π –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö –¥–ª—è –º–æ–∑–≥–∞ ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ —Å–º–µ–Ω–∞ –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –í –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –º–æ–∑–≥–∞, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –º—ã—à—Ü –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∑–æ–Ω–µ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—è. –õ—É—á—à–∏–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã –≤–æ—Å—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∏ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏–ª–∏ —É—á–µ–Ω—ã–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∞ –ü—É–∞—Ç—å–µ. –í 2018 –≥–æ–¥—É –æ–Ω–∏ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ —Ç—Ä–∏ –±–∞–∑—ã –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö ‚Äì PubMed, Embase –∏ Web-of-Science –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—à–ª–∏ –∫ –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥—É, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ —Å–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç —É—Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ—Å—Ç—å –º—ã—à—Ü –º–∞—Å—Å–∞–∂ –∏ –∫–æ–º–ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–∞—è (—É—Ç—è–≥–∏–≤–∞—é—â–∞—è) –æ–¥–µ–∂–¥–∞. –ê –¥–ª—è —Å–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è –≤–æ—Å–ø–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –º—ã—à—Ü –ª—É—á—à–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –º–∞—Å—Å–∞–∂ –≤ —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Å –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–ª–∞–¥–Ω–æ–π –≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π.
__label__society –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –≤ –°–∞–º–∞—Ä–µ –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç —Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Å—Å –∏–∑-–∑–∞ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –í –°–∞–º–∞—Ä–µ 70% —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—Ü–µ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ—è—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∏–µ –ø–ª–∞–Ω—ã –∏ –Ω–µ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—é—Ç –∏—Ö, –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç —Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Å—Å. –ö —Ç–∞–∫–∏–º —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ–ª –æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å —Ç–æ–ø-–º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π (–±–æ–ª–µ–µ 2,6 —Ç—ã—Å. —Ä–µ—Å–ø–æ–Ω–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤), –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–ª —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞.—Ä—É —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ —Å –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-—Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º ``–ê—Ç–ª–∞–Ω—Ç—ã``. –î–≤–µ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏ –æ–ø—Ä–æ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–æ–ø-–º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—å, —á—Ç–æ –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç —Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Å—Å —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ. –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π (42%) —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–ª —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å¬†—É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–º —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–∞–º–∏ —Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∞ —Ç–æ–ø-–º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä—ã –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–ª–∏ –Ω–µ—Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤–æ–ø–ª–æ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∑–∞–ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ (25%), —Ç–µ–º–ø –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ (17%), –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–Ω–∞ (16%), —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫—É—é –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å (13%) –∏¬†–æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö–∞ (10%). –ö¬†—ç—Ç–∏–º –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–∞–º —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ—Ç–Ω–µ—Å–ª–∏ –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å¬†—Å–µ–º—å–µ–π –∏¬†–¥—Ä—É–∑—å—è–º–∏, –Ω–µ—Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∫—É –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö–∞, –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –¥–ª—è —Å–∞–º–æ—Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –∏¬†–Ω–µ—Å–±–∞–ª–∞–Ω—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ. –õ–∏—à—å –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω—ã —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π (55%) –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è. –ï—â–µ 37% —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–∏¬†–±—ã —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–æ¬†–Ω–µ¬†–æ–±–ª–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã–º –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–µ–º. –°—Ä–µ–¥–∏ —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ –≤—Å–µ¬†–∂–µ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —É–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å –≤—Ä–µ–º—è —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—é, –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏ (39%) –∏¬†—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–Ω–≥–∏ (29%). –£¬†21% —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∏, –µ—â–µ 10% –ø–æ—Å–µ—â–∞—é—Ç –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–º–µ—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏—è.
__label__economy –ë–∞–Ω–∫ ¬´–ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç¬ª –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—Å—è –±–µ–∑ –ª–∏—Ü–µ–Ω–∑–∏–∏ –ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–Ω–∞—è –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –Ω–∞—Ä—É—à–∞–ª–∞ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–æ –æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–º—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é –¥–µ–Ω–µ–≥ –ë–∞–Ω–∫ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–æ–∑–≤–∞–ª –ª–∏—Ü–µ–Ω–∑–∏—é —É –¥–∞–≥–µ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ö–ë ¬´–ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç¬ª (–ö–∏–∑–∏–ª—é—Ä—Ç). –° 15 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è 2019 –≥–æ–¥–∞ –µ–º—É –∑–∞–ø—Ä–µ—â–µ–Ω–æ –æ—Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–µ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏, —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∏–ª —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ç–æ—Ä. ¬´–ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç¬ª —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–º —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤–∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–≤, –Ω–∞ 1 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è –æ–Ω –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª 386-–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –≤ –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–π —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–µ –†–§ –ø–æ –≤–µ–ª–∏—á–∏–Ω–µ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–æ–≤. –ü–æ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º –¶–ë, ¬´–ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç¬ª –¥–æ–ø—É—Å–∫–∞–ª –Ω–∞—Ä—É—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –∏ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –ë–∞–Ω–∫–∞ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –ª–µ–≥–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ (–æ—Ç–º—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é) –¥–æ—Ö–æ–¥–æ–≤, –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–º –ø—É—Ç–µ–º, –∏ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–æ—Ä–∏–∑–º–∞. –ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–Ω–∞—è –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–ª–∞ –≤ —É–ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ–º–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω –Ω–µ–ø–æ–ª–Ω—É—é –∏ –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—é –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ –ø–æ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è–º, –ø–æ–¥–ª–µ–∂–∞—â–∏–º –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—é. –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, ¬´–ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç¬ª –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏–ª —Å–æ–º–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ò–Ω—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞ –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ ¬´–ö—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∞¬ª –≤—ã—è–≤–∏–ª–∞ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞—Ä—É—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–∫–∞ –≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤—ã—Ö –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–π, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –±–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –æ—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ç–æ—Ä–∞. –í –±–∞–Ω–∫ –Ω–∞–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∞ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –¥–æ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–µ–≥–æ –ª–∏–±–æ –ª–∏–∫–≤–∏–¥–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞. –ü–æ–ª–Ω–æ–º–æ—á–∏—è –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–æ–≤ –∫—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–Ω–æ–π –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω—ã.
__label__society Attacks on Sri Lankan Muslims will resume after Presidential Election - Former Army Commander COLOMBO ( The Island / ANN ) - Former Army Commander Mahesh Senanayake, who is contesting the forthcoming Presidential Election, says that extremist forces would resume their campaign of vilification, harassment and attacks on Muslims after November 16. Participating in a dialogue with civil society members in Colombo last week, Senanayake, a decorated soldier, said that attacks on Muslims which was a common feature prior to and after the April 21 Easter Sunday suicide bomb explosions, had ceased in August. The hiatus was due to a candidate who was the darling of extremists forces contesting the Presidential polls. But they would, he predicted resume their campaign of hatred against the Muslims after November 16, regardless of whether their favourite candidate won or lost. Asked by a member of the audience, if he could prove what he was saying, Senanayake replied ``I am talking with a sense of responsibility. As Army Commander I headed the Intelligence Unit and I am still privy to certain developments.``
__label__society ¬´–ö–æ–ª—ë—Å–∞ –∏ –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç–∞ –æ—Ç–≤–∞–ª–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è¬ª. –í—è–∑—å–º–∏—á–∏ –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–±–∏—Ç—É—é –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥—É –í —Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω–µ –¥–æ–º–æ–≤ 79–±-–≤ –ø–æ —É–ª–∏—Ü–µ –õ–µ–Ω–∏–Ω–∞ –≤ –í—è–∑—å–º–µ –Ω–∞ –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–µ –Ω–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ—Å—å ¬´–∂–∏–≤–æ–≥–æ¬ª –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞. –í –∞—Å—Ñ–∞–ª—å—Ç–æ–≤–æ–º –ø–æ–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏–∏ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≥–∏–≥–∞–Ω—Ç—Å–∫–∏–µ –≤—ã–±–æ–∏–Ω—ã –∏ —è–º—ã. –ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –≤—è–∑—å–º–∏—á–µ–π, –º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã –ø–æ—Ä—Ç—è—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω—ã,¬† –µ—â—ë –Ω–µ –æ—Ç—ä–µ—Ö–∞–≤ –æ—Ç –¥–æ–º–∞. –ñ–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—è—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ö–æ—Ç—è –±—ã —è–º–æ—á–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —Å–ø–∞—Å—Ç–∏ —Å–µ–±—è, –∫–∞–∫ –ø–µ—à–µ—Ö–æ–¥–æ–≤, –∏ —Å–≤–æ–∏ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –ï–ª–∏–∑–∞–≤–µ—Ç–∞ –ß–µ—Ä–Ω—è–∫–æ–≤–∞–§–æ—Ç–æ: –ë–ª–∞–≥–æ—É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –í—è–∑—å–º–∞
__label__society –î–≤–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–ª—ë—Ç–∞ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∫–Ω—É–ª–∏—Å—å –∫—Ä—ã–ª—å—è–º–∏ –≤ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–º –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É –®–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ—Ç—å–µ–≤–æ –ü—Ä–∏–ª–µ—Ç–µ–≤—à–∏–π –∏–∑ –ú–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞ Airbus A-320 –∑–∞–¥–µ–ª –∫—Ä—ã–ª–æ–º –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π —Å–∞–º–æ–ª—ë—Ç –≤ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–º –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É –®–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ—Ç—å–µ–≤–æ –ø—Ä–∏ –∑–∞—Ä—É–ª–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ —Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∫–∏. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç –†–ò–ê –ù–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –≤—Å–µ –æ–±—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å —É—Ç–æ—á–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è, –Ω–∞ –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞ –∏–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –Ω–µ –ø–æ–≤–ª–∏—è–ª. ‚Äì –ê—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –≤ —à—Ç–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–º —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º–µ, - —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∏–ª–∏ –≤ –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å-—Å–ª—É–∂–±–µ –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞, –ø–æ–¥—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–¥–∏–≤ —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç –∞–≤–∞—Ä–∏–∏. –ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –≤ —ç–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ª—É–∂–±–∞—Ö, –≤ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–µ –∏–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –∏–∑ –ø–∞—Å—Å–∞–∂–∏—Ä–æ–≤ –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∞–ª. –°–∞–º–æ–ª—ë—Ç—ã –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ–≤—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è. –ü–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∞—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º, –ø—Ä–∏–ª–µ—Ç–µ–≤—à–∏–π –∏–∑ –ú–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–ª—ë—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∞–¥–ª–µ–∂–∏—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏¬†``–ê—ç—Ä–æ—Ñ–ª–æ—Ç``. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–æ ‚Äú–ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞‚Äù, –ú–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∞—è –º–µ–∂—Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–∫—É—Ä–∞—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∫—É –≤ —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ —Å –∏–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–º.
__label__other –í–æ–ª–æ—á–∫–æ–≤–∞ –ø–æ—Ö—É–¥–µ–ª–∞ –¥–æ –ø—É–≥–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏—è, –∏ –¥–∏–µ—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏ –±–æ—è—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ –ù–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ –ê–Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞—Å–∏—è –ø–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏–ª–∞—Å—å —Å–Ω–∏–º–∫–æ–º, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–ª–∞ –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º –¥–µ—Ä–∑–∫–æ–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–µ —Å –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–∏–∂–∫–æ–π. –ù–æ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–º –ø–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω—ã –≤–æ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—á–∏–ª–∏—Å—å. –í–æ–ª–æ—á–∫–æ–≤–∞ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∞, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –µ—Å—Ç –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –ø–æ –≤–æ—Å–µ–º—å —á–∞—Å–æ–≤ –≤ –¥–µ–Ω—å —É —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∫–∞, —Ä–µ–ø–µ—Ç–∏—Ä—É—è –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ —à–æ—É. –†–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç —Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–æ–≤—â–∏—Ü–∞ –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ —Å–Ω–∏–º–∫–∞—Ö, –≥–¥–µ –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥–∏—Ç —Ö—É–¥–æ–π –∏ –∏–∑–º–æ–∂–¥—ë–Ω–Ω–æ–π. –¢–∞–∫–æ–π –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ —ç–∫—Å-–±–∞–ª–µ—Ä–∏–Ω—ã —É –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö –≤—ã–∑–≤–∞–ª –±–µ—Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ. –ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –¥–∏–µ—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∞ –ù–∞–¥–∏ –®–∞—Ä–∫, –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º, –Ω–µ–¥–æ–ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞—é—â–∏–π –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º—ã–µ –ø–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≤–µ—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –≤—ã–π—Ç–∏ –∏–∑ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ—è, –ø–∏—à–µ—Ç –ö–ü. –ù–æ, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ, –í–æ–ª–æ—á–∫–æ–≤–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç –≤–∏—Ç–∞–º–∏–Ω—ã, –º–∏–Ω–µ—Ä–∞–ª—ã, –ë–ê–î—ã. –ù–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–µ –∏ –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å—á–∏–∫–∏ –ê–Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞—Å–∏–∏ –≤ ``–ò–Ω—Å—Ç–∞–≥—Ä–∞–º–µ``. –ù–∞–ø—É–≥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Ñ–∞–Ω–∞—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ —É —Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–æ–≤—â–∏—Ü—ã –≤—Å–∫–æ—Ä–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–Ω—É—Ç—å —Å–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã —Å–æ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å–µ–º, –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –∑–∞–ø–æ–¥–æ–∑—Ä–∏–ª–∏ –≤ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–µ–π—Å—è –∞–Ω–æ—Ä–µ–∫—Å–∏–∏. –ë—ã–≤—à–∞—è –¥–µ–≤—É—à–∫–∞ –¢–∏–º–∞—Ç–∏ –≤—ã–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ –≤ –±–∏–∫–∏–Ω–∏, –Ω–∞–ø—É–≥–∞–≤ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π —Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–æ–π –¥–∞–∂–µ –º–µ–¥–∏–∫–æ–≤
__label__not_news –†–∞—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫. BMW, Mercedes –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ ``–≤—ë–¥—Ä–∞ —Å –±–æ–ª—Ç–∞–º–∏`` –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–∫–µ –ë–∞–≤–∞—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π –∞–≤—Ç–æ–ø—Ä–æ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –≤ –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞—Ö, ``–∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—á–∏–ª—Å—è`` –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ –≤ 2005 –≥–æ–¥—É. –° —Ç–µ—Ö –ø–æ—Ä BMW –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏, –Ω–∞–¥—ë–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –ø–æ–¥ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–º. –í–Ω–µ –≤—Å—è–∫–æ–≥–æ —Å–æ–º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Å–∞–º—ã–º–∏ –æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω—ã–º–∏ –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–Ω–æ–º —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è BMW –ø—è—Ç–æ–π —Å–µ—Ä–∏–∏. –û—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∫–∞—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ–∫–æ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –≤ –∫—É–∑–æ–≤–µ –ï60 –∏ F10. BMW –ø—è—Ç–æ–π —Å–µ—Ä–∏–∏. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 150‚Äì200 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ –ü–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥ –º–∞—Å–ª–∞ –∏ –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è ‚Äî –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–∫ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ–π ``–∫–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∞–ª–∫–∏``. –¶–µ–Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç–∞ ‚Äî 120 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© Getty Images –í—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –∞–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–∞ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –∑–∞ –±–∞–≤–∞—Ä—Å–∫–∏–º –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–º, –Ω–æ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑ —Ä–µ—á—å –Ω–µ –æ —Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–µ –∏–ª–∏ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª–µ, –∞ –æ –≤–Ω–µ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂–Ω–∏–∫–µ. BMW X5 –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª—é–±—è—Ç –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏, –æ–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ –≤–æ–∑–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–æ–π –≤ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–µ —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ. –ò–∑ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –≤–Ω—É—à–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ ‚Äî —Å–±–æ–∏ –≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∏, –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞ –ö–ü–ü, –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥–æ–≤ –∏ –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è. BMW X5. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 150 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ –†–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å –ê–ö–ü–ü –∏ ``—Ä–∞–∑–¥–∞—Ç–∫–∏`` ‚Äî 120 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤. –†–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è ‚Äî 120 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á. –ü–Ω–µ–≤–º–æ–ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—Å–∫–∞ –ª–æ–º–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ 80‚Äì100 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© Daniel Pier / NurPhoto via Getty Images Citroen C4 ‚Äî —Å–∞–º—ã–π –Ω–µ–æ–±—ã—á–Ω—ã–π –∏, –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π, –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–∑ –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–Ω—ã—Ö –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–Ω–æ–º —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ. –í –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –∑–∞–≤–æ–µ–≤–∞–ª –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä—è —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω—É: –∫—É–∑–æ–≤ —Å –ø–∞–Ω–æ—Ä–∞–º–Ω–æ–π –∫—Ä—ã—à–µ–π, —Ä—É–ª—å —Å –Ω–µ–ø–æ–¥–≤–∏–∂–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç—É–ø–∏—Ü–µ–π –∏ –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–∞—è –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å. –ü—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞, –±–ª–∏–∂–µ –∫ 100 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á–∞–º –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞ —É—Å–ø–µ–≤–∞–µ—Ç —Å–ª–æ–º–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Ä–∞–∑, –∞ —á–∏–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Ç–∞–∫–∏–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏ ``–≤ –ø—Ä–µ–∫–ª–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ`` –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –±–µ—Ä—ë—Ç—Å—è. –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–∫ ‚Äî –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è –∫–æ—Ä–æ–±–∫–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—á AL4. Citroen C4. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 90 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ –ü–ª–æ—Ö–∞—è –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∫–∞, –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã —Å —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–æ–π –∏ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–æ–π –æ—Ö–ª–∞–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è, –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–∞—è —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞–ø—á–∞—Å—Ç–µ–π –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø–æ —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—é —Å –Ω–µ–º–µ—Ü–∫–∏–º–∏ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞–º–∏ –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© AP Photo / Laurent Rebours –°—Ä–∞–∑—É –∑–∞ Citroen C4 —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª—Å—è –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–ø—Ä–æ–º–∞ ‚Äî –∫—Ä–æ—Å—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä Peugeot 3008. –≠—Ç–∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–æ–¥–Ω–æ–∫—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ –ø–æ–¥–ø–∞–¥–∞–ª–∏ –ø–æ–¥ –æ—Ç–∑—ã–≤–Ω—ã–µ –∫–∞–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏, –Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã —Å —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–æ–π, –∫–æ—Ä–æ–±–∫–æ–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—á –∏ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–æ–π –æ—Ö–ª–∞–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –ª–∏—à—å –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –≤—ã–ø—É—Å–∫–∞ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫–æ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è. ``–õ–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ`` —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—ã—Ö –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–µ—á–∏ –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ–ª—å—Ü–µ–≤. Peugeot 3008. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 80 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ ``–ó–∞–∫–∏–ø–∞–Ω–∏–µ`` –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è, –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å –ê–ö–ü–ü, –∫–∞–ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞—è —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∞, –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∏–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© AP Photo / Keystone, Sandro Campardo –°–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è –±–æ–ª—å —Ç–æ–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏–µ—Ö–∞–ª–∞ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—é –∏–∑ –ì–µ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–∏–∏. –ù–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ–Ω–∞ Direct-shift gearbox, –∏–ª–∏ DSG. –≠—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–∏ –±—É–∫–≤—ã —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—ã –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ–ª—å—Ü–∞–º –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π Volkswagen, Audi –∏ Skoda. –ü–µ—Ä–≤–æ–µ –ø–æ–∫–æ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ö–ü–ü –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–æ—Å—å —É–¥–∞—á–Ω—ã–º, –æ–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ –≤ 2006 –≥–æ–¥—É –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª—Å—è —Å–µ–º–∏—Å—Ç—É–ø–µ–Ω—á–∞—Ç—ã–π ``—Å—É—Ö–æ–π`` —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∞–≤–ª–∏–≤–∞–ª—Å—è –Ω–∞ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏ VW Passat, VW Golf, VW Jetta –∏ VW Tiguan, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –Ω–∞ —Ü–µ–ª—ã–π —Ä—è–¥ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π VAG. –†–ö–ü–ü –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∞—Å—å –∫—É–¥–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ—Ä–Ω–µ–µ –æ–±—ã—á–Ω—ã—Ö ``–∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–≤``, –Ω–æ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º —Å –Ω–µ–π –±—ã–ª–æ –≤—ã—à–µ –∫—Ä—ã—à–∏, –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ª–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥. –î–µ–ø—É—Ç–∞—Ç –ì–æ—Å–¥—É–º—ã –í—è—á–µ—Å–ª–∞–≤ –õ—ã—Å–∞–∫–æ–≤ –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª –∑–∞–ø—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏ —Å DSG-7 –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã –Ω–µ –∑–∞—Ç—Ä–∞–≥–∏–≤–∞–ª–∏ ``–º–æ–∫—Ä—É—é`` –º–æ–¥–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—é ‚Äî DSG-6. –ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏ —Å –†–ö–ü–ü DSG. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 150 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –°—Ü–µ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏–ª–∏ –º–µ—Ö–∞—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω –ª–æ–º–∞—é—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑ –≤ 50‚Äì60 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤. –°—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π —á–µ–∫ –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç ‚Äî –æ—Ç 50 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π –∏ –≤—ã—à–µ –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© AP Photo / Thomas Kienzle –ò –æ–ø—è—Ç—å –∫ –Ω–µ–º—Ü–∞–º. Opel Astra H –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª –≤ —Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Ä–∂–∞–≤–µ—é—Ç –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ, –Ω–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è —É–∂–µ –æ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–∞—Ö. –° –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–æ–π –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–Ω–æ–º —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º, –æ–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –º–µ–Ω—è—Ç—å —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –≤–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º—è –∏ —Ö–æ—Ç—è –±—ã —Ä–∞–∑ –≤ –º–µ—Å—è—Ü –∑–∞–µ–∑–∂–∞—Ç—å –≤ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å –Ω–∞ –¥–∏–∞–≥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏–∫—É, –Ω–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–∏–∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π. –õ–µ—á–∏—Ç—å ``–ê—Å—Ç—Ä—É`` –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ ‚Äî —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π —á–µ–∫ –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç—É–µ—Ç —Å 20 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π. Opel Astra H. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 80‚Äì100 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –†–æ–±–æ—Ç Easytronic, —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –æ—Ö–ª–∞–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏ —Ç–µ–ø–ª–æ–æ–±–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–∞, —Å–ª–∞–±—ã–π –ø–æ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–º –º–µ—Ä–∫–∞–º –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä, –Ω–µ–∂–Ω–∞—è –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –∫—É–∑–æ–≤–µ –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© Wikipedia / Rudolf Stricker –Ø–ø–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏, –∫—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏, —Ç–æ–∂–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç –æ—Ç ``–¥–µ—Ç—Å–∫–∏—Ö –±–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–µ–π``. –ö –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—É, Nissan Murano –¥–æ–ª–≥–æ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–ª—Å—è –µ–¥–≤–∞ –ª–∏ –Ω–µ —Å–∞–º—ã–º –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–Ω—ã–º –∫—Ä–æ—Å—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä–æ–º, —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º –≤ –°—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–µ –≤–æ—Å—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–µ–≥–æ —Å–æ–ª–Ω—Ü–∞. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å –µ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç–∞ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –±—ã–ª–∞ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –∫ –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—é –ø—Ä–µ—Ç–µ–Ω–∑–∏–π –º–∏–Ω–∏–º—É–º, —Ç–æ –Ω–∏—Å—Å–∞–Ω–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞—Ç–æ—Ä –Ω–∞ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞—Ö –≤ –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ –ø—è—Ç–∏-—Å–µ–º–∏ –∏ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –ª–µ—Ç ‚Äî —Å–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è –±–æ–ª—å. –õ–æ–º–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ–Ω, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ, —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –∏ —Ü–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–º. –°—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç–∞ ‚Äî –æ—Ç 60 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π. Nissan Murano. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 80‚Äì100 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ò–∑–Ω–æ—Å –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞, —Ö—Ä—É–ø–∫–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—Å–∫–∞. –†—ã—á–∞–≥–∏, —Å—Ç–æ–π–∫–∏ —Å—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞, —Ä—É–ª–µ–≤—ã–µ –Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∏, —Å–∞–π–ª–µ–Ω—Ç–±–ª–æ–∫–∏ –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞—è ``–º–µ–ª–æ—á—å`` –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© AP Photo / Reed Saxon –ù—É –∏ –∫—É–¥–∞ –∂–µ –±–µ–∑ Mini Cooper. –≠—Ç–∏ –º–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏–µ –∏, –Ω–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –≤–∑–≥–ª—è–¥, ``–∏–≥—Ä—É—à–µ—á–Ω—ã–µ`` –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∫–∏ –ø–æ-–ø—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–µ–º—É –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª—é–±—è—Ç –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏, –¥–∞–∂–µ –Ω–µ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä—è –Ω–∞ –¥–∏–∫—É—é, –∑–∞–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—É—é —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å. –û–±—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏ —Ä–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç Mini –ø—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã –∏—Ö —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ß—É—Ç—å –ø–æ–µ–∑–¥–∏–ª ‚Äî —É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã. –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ —É –µ–≥–æ –¥–æ–Ω–æ—Ä–∞ BMW, ‚Äî —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∞ –∏ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–∫–∞. –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏–µ Mini —Å –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º ‚Äî –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞, —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç—å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ç—è–∂–µ–ª–æ. Mini Cooper. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 80‚Äì100 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –†–µ–º–æ–Ω—Ç –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ ‚Äî –æ—Ç 70 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π, –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∞ –≠–ë–£ ‚Äî –æ—Ç 80 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á. –•—Ä—É–ø–∫–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—Å–∫–∞. –ù–æ–≤—ã–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç—ã –Ω–µ –ª—é–±—è—Ç –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—É—é –µ–∑–¥—É –∏ –≥—Ä–µ—é—Ç—Å—è –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© AP Photo / David Zalubowski Mercedes ML –∑–∞—Å–ª—É–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–µ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö –Ω–µ–Ω–∞–¥—ë–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–µ–π –Ω–∞ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–Ω–æ–º —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ. –£ –±–∞–≤–∞—Ä—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∫—Ä–æ—Å—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —Å –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º —É—Å–ø–µ—Ö–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–≤–∞–ª—Å—è –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö –ª–µ—Ç, —Ü–µ–ª—ã–π –≤–æ—Ä–æ—Ö ``–¥–µ—Ç—Å–∫–∏—Ö –±–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–µ–π``, –ª–µ—á–∏—Ç—å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –±—É–¥—É—â–∏–º –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ–ª—å—Ü–∞–º. –≠—Ç–∞ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –∑–∞–Ω—è–ª–∞ 20-–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –≤ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–µ Warranty Direct –ø–æ –Ω–∞–¥—ë–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —É–∑–ª–æ–≤ –∏ –∞–≥—Ä–µ–≥–∞—Ç–æ–≤, –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—ã –Ω–µ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é—Ç –ø–æ–∫—É–ø–∞—Ç—å –º–∞—à–∏–Ω—ã —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—à–µ 2011 –≥–æ–¥–∞ –≤—ã–ø—É—Å–∫–∞. Mercedes ML. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 60‚Äì80 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ú–∞—Å–ª—è–Ω–æ–µ –≥–æ–ª–æ–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ, —Ö—Ä—É–ø–∫–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—Å–∫–∞, –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∏–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∏. –ï—Å—Ç—å —Å–ª—É—á–∞–∏, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ê–ö–ü–ü ``—É–º–∏—Ä–∞–ª–∏`` –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ 20‚Äì30 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞ –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© Flickr/RLGNZLZ –ó–∞–º—ã–∫–∞–µ—Ç —Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥ –æ–º–µ—Ä–∑–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∫–∏ Mazda 6. –ü–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã–π —É —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏—è–Ω —Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª—Å—è –ø–ª–æ—Ö –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∑–∏–º–æ–π ‚Äî –æ–Ω –∏ –ª–µ—Ç–æ–º –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–ª –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ–ª—å—Ü–∞–º –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º—É–º –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º —Å —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –∂–µ –∫–æ—Å–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å—é. –ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏ Mazda 6 –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –∏ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫–æ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á–µ–º —É –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, –æ–±—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ò–∑-–∑–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤–ª–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –∑–∞–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π. –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ –±—é–¥–∂–µ—Ç–Ω–æ–π –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª–∫–∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—å–µ—Ä–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è ``–æ–±–ª–µ–∑–∞–ª–∞`` –∫ 50 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á–∞–º –ø—Ä–æ–±–µ–≥–∞, –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–ª–∏—Å—å –∏ –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã. Mazda 6. –ö—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ ‚Äî 80‚Äì100 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á –∫–∏–ª–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –†—É–ª–µ–≤–∞—è —Ä–µ–π–∫–∞, —Ö—Ä—É–ø–∫–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—Å–∫–∞, –Ω–µ–∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ç–æ–ø–ª–∏–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—Å–æ—Å–∞, —É—Å–∏–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è —Ä—É–ª—è –∏ –Ω–∏–∑–∫–æ–µ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –õ–ö–ü –§–æ—Ç–æ ¬© Flickr/RLGNZLZ
__label__entertainment Age of Empires 4 gameplay trailer shows off beautiful medieval RTS warfare X019 throws up a treat for strategy gamers (Image credit: Microsoft) Microsoft may have not revealed much new about Xbox Project Scarlett at its X019 conference, but it did reveal a host of new games, and one hotly anticipated one in particular ‚Äì Age of Empires 4. The veteran real-time strategy series has had a sequel cooking for some years now, and Microsoft took the opportunity to finally pull the covers off what the game's gameplay will look like. And, if you're a fan of Age of Empires 2 ‚Äì which you should be, as it's one of the greatest strategy games of all time ‚Äì you're in for a treat. Age of Empires 4 looks like a true successor to that lauded title, with action-packed medieval warfare and city building: Those raised on the isometric Age of Empires titles will be looking at those detailed building and troop models with glee ‚Äì this looks set to be a beautiful strategy game, with battles taking place on a grand scale. The trailer also gives us our first look at some of the civilisations that will be playable in the game, with what looks like the Mongols and the English going head to head. And yes, the uber-powerful trebuchet ranged units will be making a return ‚Äì watch how their missiles cause a castle fortification to crumble. Being developed by Relic, known for the superb Company of Heroes and Warhammer 40,000 strategy series', we've yet to receive a full release date for Age of Empires 4. But needless to say, we can't wait to strap on a suit of armour and start barking orders at our pikemen. See more Gaming news

—Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å-—Å–ª—É–∂–±–∞ –£–§–°–ë –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –ø–æ –†–µ—Å–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–µ –ö—Ä—ã–º –∏ –°–µ–≤–∞—Å—Ç–æ–ø–æ–ª—é. ¬´–°–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–æ–≤ –±–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—é –≤ –ø–æ–∫—É—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–±—ã—Ç –Ω–∞—Ä–∫–æ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤ –≤ –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω–æ–º —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Ä–µ –∏ –≤ –Ω–µ–∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º –∫—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–≤–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏
