__label__economy Novikov Group –æ—Ç–∫—Ä–æ–µ—Ç —Ç—Ä–∏ –∑–∞–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ ¬´–õ—É–∂–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ö¬ª –ì—Ä—É–ø–ø–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π –ê—Ä–∫–∞–¥–∏—è –ù–æ–≤–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤¬†–æ–ª–∏–º–ø–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ ¬´–õ—É–∂–Ω–∏–∫–∏¬ª. –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ —Ç—Ä–∏ —Ç–æ—á–∫–∏ –æ–±—â–µ–π –ø–ª–æ—â–∞–¥—å—é –≤¬†—Ç—ã—Å—è—á—É –∫–≤–∞–¥—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤¬†–æ—Ç–∫—Ä–æ—é—Ç –≤–æ¬†–î–≤–æ—Ä—Ü–µ –≤–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–∏–¥–æ–≤ —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞. –ù–∞¬†–Ω–∏—Ö, –ø–æ¬†–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∫–µ —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞, –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–µ¬†–º–µ–Ω–µ–µ 100 –º–∏–ª–ª–∏–æ–Ω–æ–≤ —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π.¬†–ü–æ¬†—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –ù–æ–≤–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞, –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –≤¬†¬´–õ—É–∂–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ö¬ª –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ø–æ—è–≤–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∏¬†–¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ –µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç—ã. –ù–∞¬†–ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–º —ç—Ç–∞–∂–µ –ø–æ—è–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –∫–æ—Ñ–µ–π–Ω—è —Å¬†–≤—ã–ø–µ—á–∫–æ–π –∏¬†—Å—ç–Ω–¥–≤–∏—á–∞–º–∏ —Å–æ¬†—Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏–º —á–µ–∫–æ–º –≤¬†200‚Äì700 —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π¬†–∏¬†—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–Ω –Ω–∞¬†150 –≥–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π (–ø–æ–µ—Å—Ç—å —Ç–∞–º –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∑–∞¬†1,5‚Äì2 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á–∏), –µ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏—é¬†–æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è—Ç –ø–æ–∑–¥–Ω–µ–µ. –í¬†–∞–∫–≤–∞–ø–∞—Ä–∫–µ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä–æ–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ñ–∞—Å—Ç—Ñ—É–¥-–∫–∞—Ñ–µ —Å¬†—á–µ–∫–æ–º –æ—Ç¬†300 –¥–æ¬†500 —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π. –û–ª–∏–º–ø–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å ¬´–õ—É–∂–Ω–∏–∫–∏¬ª, –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã–≤—à–∏–π—Å—è –≤¬†1956¬†–≥–æ–¥—É, –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –ø—è—Ç—å –ª–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏. –ü–æ–º–∏–º–æ –î–≤–æ—Ä—Ü–∞ –≤–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–∏–¥–æ–≤ —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞, —Ç–∞–º —Å—Ç—Ä–æ—è—Ç —Ç–µ–Ω–Ω–∏—Å–Ω—ã–π —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä, –ª–µ–¥–æ–≤—É—é –∞—Ä–µ–Ω—É ¬´–ö—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–ª–ª¬ª –∏ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å ¬´–î—Ä—É–∂–±–∞¬ª. –ò—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫: ¬´–í–µ–¥–æ–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏¬ª
__label__sport Need to be better when we bat first in T20Is, says Vikram Rathour NEW DELHI: India batting coach Vikram Rathour believes one area where the team currently needs to work upon leading up to the T20 World Cup is to bat well while setting up a target. Speaking ahead of the three-match T20I series against Bangladesh beginning on Sunday, Rathour on Friday said Team India bats well when they are chasing, but when it comes to setting up a total, they need to improve. ``Basically, trying out different players and combinations. Like in the last series, we deliberately batted first which we lost. That's one area we need to work on. ``We need to bat better when we bat first in T20I cricket. We chase pretty well. That's one area we as a team are looking to improve,`` he said while addressing the reporters at the Arun Jaitley Stadium, the venue for the first T20I. He also insisted that there shouldn't be too much of changing and chopping within the team while preparing for the next year's T20 World Cup. ``You cannot be changing too much``, when a big tournament is coming, he said. ``We need to know what's the core of our team and maintain that core and in between try out new few players. Hopefully if and when they do well, that can help our team combination,`` Rathour said. A lot has been talked about the poor weather conditions in the national capital. The air quality has been deteriorating ever since Diwali and on Friday it reached the 'severe+' category. Several Bangladeshi players were seen wearing masks while practising on Thursday and Friday. However, Rathour believes the Indian team is used to playing in such conditions and therefore, it won't be a problem when they take the field on Sunday. ``I have played all my life in north India. We are used to these conditions and we have played under these conditions. So, nothing special is being taken care of. Pollution is there but the game has been scheduled. We are here to play and hopefully win,`` he said. The batting coach is also expecting Bangladesh to give a tough fight, especially in the T20Is, even in the absence of their star players like Shakib al Hasan and Tamim Iqbal. ``Missing out on top players of course makes a difference to the team. But T20 is the only format where you don't players miss too much. But the amount of T20 cricket that is there being played in Bangladesh, I am sure they have good players,`` Rathour said. ``In today's game and age, you expect all the international teams to compete well against you. So, we are well prepared and we are hoping and are sure that Bangladesh will give their best. But we are looking to do our best. We are taking this series as a preparation for next year's World Cup. We are looking at all the options available,`` he added. Speaking on Shakib's ban, the Indian batting coach said: ``Of course, it's an unfortunate incident and you don't want things like that in cricket.``
__label__economy –ù–µ–º–µ—Ü–∫–∏–µ –°–ú–ò –∑–∞—è–≤–∏–ª–∏ –æ ``–≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏`` —Ä—É–±–ª—è –ù–µ–º–µ—Ü–∫–æ–µ –∏–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ¬†Focus –≤—ã–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–ª–æ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª –æ–± —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–π —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏ ``–ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–∞–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–π –∏ —à–æ–∫–∞ –æ—Ç –Ω–µ—Ñ—Ç—è–Ω—ã—Ö —Ü–µ–Ω: –≤–æ—Ç –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É —Ä—É–±–ª—å –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è`` —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥, —á—Ç–æ —Ä—É–±–ª—å —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω—è–µ—Ç —Å—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å, –Ω–µ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä—è –Ω–∞ –≤—Å–µ –ø–æ–ª–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –í —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ —Ä—É–±–ª—é,¬†–ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –≤—ã–∑–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–∞–Ω–∫—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ –∏ —Å–Ω–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º —Ü–µ–Ω –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ—Ñ—Ç—å –ø–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è, —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —É–∫—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –ø–æ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—é –∫ –µ—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ –¥–æ–ª–ª–∞—Ä—É, –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –∏–∑ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–∏—Ö –≤–∞–ª—é—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç—ã—Ö —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≥–æ–¥—É. –í–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —Ä—É–±–ª—å –∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –∑–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Å–Ω–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–æ—Ö–æ–¥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –°–®–ê –∏ –ï–≤—Ä–æ–ø–µ. –ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏ –æ—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç—É –≤–∞–ª—é—Ç—É –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª—Å—è –≤–µ—Å—å–º–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫.
__label__society Watchdog sues FBI over facial recognition secrecy WASHINGTON:¬†A civil liberties watchdog Thursday sued the FBI and other federal agencies claiming the government is improperly withholding information on how it uses a facial recognition database of millions of Americans. ‚ÄúBecause of the FBI‚Äôs secrecy, little is known about how the agency is supercharging its surveillance activities with face recognition technology,‚Äù said Kade Crockford of the American Civil Liberties Union in a statement. ‚ÄúThe public has a right to know when, where, and how law enforcement agencies are using face recognition technology, and what safeguards, if any, are in place to protect our rights.‚Äù The ACLU lawsuit naming the FBI, Justice Department and Drug Enforcement Administration said the agencies ‚Äúfailed to produce any responsive documents‚Äù in response to a Freedom of Information Act request. Activists believe the FBI is currently collecting biometric data on people‚Äôs faces, irises, walking patterns, and voices, and has a database of at least 640 million images of adults in the United States. ‚ÄúFace and other biometric surveillance technologies can enable undetectable, persistent, and suspicionless surveillance on an unprecedented scale,‚Äù Crockford said. ‚ÄúThis dystopian surveillance technology threatens to fundamentally alter our free society into one where we‚Äôre treated as suspects to be tracked and monitored by the government 24/7.‚Äù Backers of facial recognition say it is a useful tool that can make it easier to catch criminals and ensure safety at airports and venues with large crowds. But privacy and civil liberties activists say the technology remains flawed and could ensnare innocent people. San Francisco has banned the use of the technology by official agencies, and some researchers have warned of errors, notably in identifying minorities, and of the creation of large databases which could be breached or hacked. The lawsuit filed in Massachusetts asks the government to turn over information on what data it has and who can access it. The Justice Department did not immediately respond to a query on the complaint.
__label__society Gantz Meets 'Joint List' Leaders to Discuss Government Formation Prime Minister-designate Benny Gantz held negotiations on Thursday regarding forming the government. The first meeting was with Likud, but it ended with deep frustration. The second meeting was held with representatives from the Joint List and it ended with positive approaches towards the Arab citizens in Israel.However, none of the meetings succeeded in resolving the issue towards the next government's form.Gantz stated that he is holding important talks with parties‚Äô heads and that the ambiance of these meetings contradicts with what is being published in the media.He expressed optimism that all parties‚Äô leaders are aware of the dangers of third elections. They also show responsibility in preventing moving towards elections since it will damage the strategic and economic conditions.Gantz said he wants ``a broad, liberal unity government ‚Äì or any other way to form a government‚Ä¶I will make every effort to make progress‚Ä¶I am determined to have a government and not an election.‚ÄùMinisters Yariv Levin and Zeev Elkin of Likud considered that Gantz is pretending that he wants a unity government but they got the impressions that these negotiations are a lie and only a play by the Blue and White in front of the media.The real negotiations are held by Gantz with President of Joint List MP Ayman Awda for the sake of forming an extremist oligarchy with the Arab.Further, Yisrael Beiteinu leader Avigdor Lieberman knocked off the option of the formation of a minority government that would be supported from outside the coalition by the Joint List. In such a scenario, the Joint List would vote in favor of government legislation but not join the governing coalition.
__label__other –ò—Ä–∏–Ω—É –®–µ–π–∫ –≤¬†—É—à–∫–∞—Ö –ú–∏–∫–∫–∏ –ú–∞—É—Å–∞ –∏¬†–ø—Ä–æ–∑—Ä–∞—á–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ—Ñ—Ç–µ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∏–ª–∏ –≤¬†–ù—å—é-–ô–æ—Ä–∫–µ 33-–ª–µ—Ç–Ω—è—è –ò—Ä–∏–Ω–∞ –®–µ–π–∫ –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª–∞ –≤¬†–æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤—ã –ø–∞–ø–∞—Ä–∞—Ü—Ü–∏ –≤¬†–ù—å—é-–ô–æ—Ä–∫–µ. –ú–æ–¥–µ–ª—å —Å–ø–µ—à–∏–ª–∞ –Ω–∞¬†–≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–∫—É-–º–∞—Å–∫–∞—Ä–∞–¥ –ø–æ¬†—Å–ª—É—á–∞—é –•—ç–ª–ª–æ—É–∏–Ω–∞. –ë—ã–≤—à–∞—è –≤–æ–∑–ª—é–±–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –ë—Ä—ç–¥–ª–∏ –ö—É–ø–µ—Ä–∞ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–ª–∞ —Å–æ–±–ª–∞–∑–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑ –≤–æ–∑–ª—é–±–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ú–∏–∫–∫–∏ –ú–∞—É—Å–∞, –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∞ –ú–∏–Ω–Ω–∏ –ú–∞—É—Å. –ù–∞¬†–ò—Ä–∏–Ω–µ –±—ã–ª —á–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–π –ª–æ–Ω–≥—Å–ª–∏–≤ –∏–∑¬†–ø—Ä–æ–∑—Ä–∞—á–Ω–æ–π —Ç–∫–∞–Ω–∏, –ø–æ–¥¬†–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –æ–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞–¥–µ–ª–∞ –±—Ä–∞ –≤¬†—Ç–æ–Ω, –∞¬†—Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∞–ª–∞—è –º–∏–Ω–∏-—é–±–∫–∞ –≤¬†–≥–æ—Ä–æ—à–µ–∫¬†‚Äî –ø–ª–∞—Ç—å–µ —Å¬†—Ç–∞–∫–∏–º –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ç–æ–º –Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ—Ç–∏–ø –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏. –°–≤–µ—Ä—Ö—É –®–µ–π–∫ –Ω–∞–∫–∏–Ω—É–ª–∞ —Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã–π –ø–ª–∞—â Burberry. –û–±—Ä–∞–∑ –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏–ª–∏ —É—à–∫–∏ –ú–∏–Ω–Ω–∏ —Å¬†–±–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–∫–æ–º, –∫–∞–ø—Ä–æ–Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –∫–æ–ª–≥–æ—Ç–∫–∏ —Å¬†—Ä–∏—Å—É–Ω–∫–æ–º, —Å—É–º–æ—á–∫–∞ –≤¬†—Ç–æ–Ω —é–±–∫–µ –∏¬†—ç–ª–µ–≥–∞–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Ç—É—Ñ–ª–∏. –í–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ —è—Ä–∫–æ–≥–æ –º–∞–∫–∏—è–∂–∞ –ò—Ä–∏–Ω–∞ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∞ –æ—á–∞—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –≥—Ä–∏–º —Å¬†–º–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏–º –Ω–æ—Å–∏–∫–æ–º –∏¬†—É—à–∫–∞–º–∏ –∫–∞–∫ —É¬†–º—ã—à–∫–∏. –û–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ –∫–æ—Ä–æ–ª–µ–≤–æ–π —Å–µ–∫—Å—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤ –Ω–∞¬†–•—ç–ª–ª–æ—É–∏–Ω –≤¬†—ç—Ç–æ–º –≥–æ–¥—É —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∞ –ö–∞–π–ª–∏ –î–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–µ—Ä. –ó–Ω–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–ø–ª–æ—Ç–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –≤¬†—Ä—É—Å–∞–ª–æ—á–∫—É –ê—Ä–∏—ç–ª—å –∏¬†–∫–∏–Ω–æ–¥–∏–≤—É –ú—ç—Ä–∏–ª–∏–Ω –ú–æ–Ω—Ä–æ. –ê¬†–µ–µ¬†—Å–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞, –ö–∏–º –ö–∞—Ä–¥–∞—à—å—è–Ω, —Ä–µ—à–∏–ª–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å–∞–º—ã–º –≥–ª–∞–º—É—Ä–Ω—ã–º –∞–¥–≤–æ–∫–∞—Ç–æ–º –≠–ª—å –í—É–¥—Å –∏–∑¬†—Ñ–∏–ª—å–º–∞ ¬´–ë–ª–æ–Ω–¥–∏–Ω–∫–∞ –≤¬†–∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–µ¬ª.
__label__society –í —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤, –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–∏—Ö—Å—è –ø–æ–¥ —É–≥—Ä–æ–∑–æ–π, –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª–∏ —Å–æ–±–æ—Ä –ù–æ—Ç—Ä-–î–∞–º –∏ –æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ü–∞—Å—Ö–∏ –í—Å–µ–º–∏—Ä–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ–Ω–¥ –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç—ã –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –∏–∑ 25 –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ–¥ —É–≥—Ä–æ–∑–æ–π —É—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç—ã. –û–± —ç—Ç–æ–º –ø–∏—à–µ—Ç –ú–µ–¥—É–∑–∞. –û—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—è¬†–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫—É–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑ –≤ –¥–≤–∞ –≥–æ–¥–∞. –í —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –≤–æ—à–ª–∏, –≤ —á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Å–æ–±–æ—Ä –ù–æ—Ç—Ä-–î–∞–º –≤ –ü–∞—Ä–∏–∂–µ, –≥–¥–µ –≤ –º–∞–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–æ—à–µ–ª –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–∂–∞—Ä, —Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –¥–æ–ª–∏–Ω–∞ –∏–Ω–∫–æ–≤ –≤ –ü–µ—Ä—É, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π¬†—É–≥—Ä–æ–∂–∞—é—Ç –ø–ª–∞–Ω—ã –ø–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤—É –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞, –∏ –æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –ü–∞—Å—Ö–∏, —Å–∫—É–ª—å–ø—Ç—É—Ä—ã –∏ –Ω–∞—Å–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–∏—Å—É–Ω–∫–∏ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞—é—Ç –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É—Ö–æ–¥–∞ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö¬†–ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º. –ú–µ–∂–¥—É –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª–∏ –≤ —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫, –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∞ —Å—É–º–º–∞ –≤ 1,6 –º–∏–ª–ª–∏–æ–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–ª–ª–∞—Ä–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç —Å–ø–æ–Ω—Å–æ—Ä—ã –í—Å–µ–º–∏—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–æ–Ω–¥–∞ –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç—ã –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤. –ù–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω–∏–º, –≤ —è–ø–æ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–º –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–µ –ù–∞—Ö–∞ –≤ –ø—Ä–µ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–µ –û–∫–∏–Ω–∞–≤–∞ –∑–∞–≥–æ—Ä–µ–ª—Å—è –∑–∞–º–æ–∫ –°—é—Ä–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≤–Ω–µ—Å–µ–Ω –≤ —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –í—Å–µ–º–∏—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—Å–ª–µ–¥–∏—è –Æ–ù–ï–°–ö–û.

—É–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç –Ω–∞ —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ, —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è—à–Ω–µ–µ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–µ –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–∞, –≥–¥–µ –Ω–µ—Ç –æ–≥—Ä–∞–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã —É–ª–∏—Ü—ã, –Ω–µ—Ç –ø–æ–¥–ø–æ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö __label__sport Tom Curry's first club want him to come home Tom Curry‚Äôs first club have expressed their pride in the England flanker following his appearance in the World Cup final. Crewe & Nantwich RUFC, the club Curry and his twin brother Ben were at from the age of four to 16 before joining Sale Sharks‚Äô academy, hosted a screening of the final on Saturday. A crowd of over 150, some of whom wore Tom Curry masks, were at the clubhouse watching as England fell short of securing the Webb Ellis Trophy in Yokohama, losing 32-12 to South Africa. While there was disappointment at the result, club vice chair Andy Pemberton said he was ‚Äúvery proud‚Äù of the 21-year-old, a nominee for World Rugby‚Äôs player of the year award. Pemberton ‚Äì who did some coaching with the twins during their time at Crewe & Nantwich and played for the club alongside their father David ‚Äì told the PA news agency: ‚ÄúYou watch the national anthem and I always look for who is singing it. Tom‚Äôs head was straight back and it was at the top of his voice. Very proud of the boy. Click here to see the video ‚ÄúHe is a young lad, he‚Äôs 21. I don‚Äôt think anybody would have envisaged his impact. You look at his work ethic, his technique, and that is what makes him stand out from any other natural back-row player. ‚ÄúContinue with the England team, flourish with Sale, the British and Irish Lions ‚Äì the world is his oyster.‚Äù Curry has been back to the club on a number of occasions since leaving, including in spring this year when he and Ben were supporting a fundraising event for mental health charity Mind, donating a collection of their old shirts to be auctioned off. And Pemberton said: ‚ÄúI think he‚Äôll come back to the UK, have some dinner with his mum and dad and then he‚Äôll come down the club, because everyone down here is bursting to see him, to pat him on the back and shake his hand and say well done because his performance throughout the World Cup has been fantastic.‚Äù When asked about Curry being an inspiration, Pemberton said: ‚ÄúThe first time he touched the ball, the first time he tackled, the whole room lifted up. ‚Äú‚ÄôGo on Tom!‚Äô ‚Äì that was the cry. You could see it.‚Äù Club president David Potts, who has been a member since 1963, said: ‚ÄúVery disappointed, but Tom had a great game I thought. ‚ÄúHe has had a great game all the competition and we‚Äôre proud that him and his brother have played at the club.‚Äù Click here to see the video
__label__sport Rugby World Cup 2019 | All you need to know: All Blacks v Wales battle for bronze NZ Herald It‚Äôs the game no one wants to play; the ultimate Rugby World Cup booby prize, the bronze playoff match for third and fourth. But, despite the agony of their semifinal defeat loss to England the night before, the All Blacks are intent of putting in a performance they can be proud of when they face Wales at Tokyo Stadium on Friday night. For several, including skipper Kieran Read and coach Steve Hansen, it will be the last time they are closely involved with the All Blacks. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre playing, obviously, so we will treat it like any test match,‚Äù Read said. ‚ÄúIt will be a bit different for us but we‚Äôll prepare as well as we can and perform as best we can. We‚Äôre All Blacks so it‚Äôs a chance for us to pull on the jersey again. ‚ÄúFor some of us it may be our last chance. There are a few things there what we‚Äôll work through this week and come Friday we‚Äôll be ready to go.‚Äù What was plainly obvious still was how much Read was still hurting from that 19-7 defeat at the hands of England. Continue reading below‚Ä¶ Click here to see the video He was close to tears when describing how he returned to his hotel room to see cards sent by his children on the occasion of his 34th birthday, and Hansen was close to breaking too when asked who he rang from the side of the Yokohama Stadium pitch straight after the loss. It was his wife Natasha. So getting up for this next challenge will be one of the toughest of their careers and several players not involved in the England loss will get a run; men such as Ben Smith and Ryan Crotty, along with Sonny Bill Williams, on the bench for the last two games here. Hansen said it wasn‚Äôt for him to comment on whether the playoff for what is effectively second and third losers should be played. Like it or not, it‚Äôs a test, and he and his men still have a remarkable record to protect. ‚ÄúThe fact is the game‚Äôs there and the fact is we have to get up,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre the inconvenient facts. How do we do that? Well, we get connected again and set ourselves an immediate goal and work hard to make sure that we really enjoy this week. It will be the last week that this team is together and we have an opportunity to do it well. ‚ÄúI know in talking to the boys we‚Äôll get a response.‚Äù Match details:¬†Friday, November 1, 10pm (NZ time), Tokyo Stadium, Tokyo. Referee:¬†Wayne Barnes. All Blacks:¬†15. Beauden Barrett, 14. Ben Smith, 13. Ryan Crotty, 12. Sonny Bill Williams, 11. Rieko Ioane, 10. Richie Mo‚Äôunga, 9. Aaron Smith, 8. Kieran Read (c), 7. Sam Cane, 6. Shannon Frizell, 5. Scott Barrett, 4. Brodie Retallick, 3. Nepo Laulala, 2. Dane Coles, 1. Joe Moody Reserves:¬†16. Liam Coltman, 17. Atu Moli, 18. Angus Ta‚Äôavao, 19. Patrick Tuipulotu, 20. Matt Todd, 21. Brad Weber, 22. Anton Lienert-Brown, 23. Jordie Barrett Wales:¬†15. Hallam Amos, 14. Owen Lane, 13. Jonathan Davies, 12. Owen Watkin, 11. Josh Adams, 10. Rhys Patchell, 9. Tomos Williams, 8. Ross Moriarty, 7. James Davies, 6. Justin Tipuric, 5. Alun Wyn Jones (c), 4. Adam Beard, 3. Dillon Lewis, 2. Ken Owens, 1. Nicky Smith Reserves:¬†16. Hadleigh Parkes Head to head:¬†The two sides have met 34 times, with New Zealand winning on 31 occasions. Wales have claimed only three victories ‚Äì the last coming on 19 December 1953 in Cardiff. Last five encounters ‚Ä¢ 2017 ‚Äì All Blacks 33, Wales 18‚Ä¢ 2016 ‚Äì All Blacks 46, Wales 6‚Ä¢ 2016 ‚Äì All Blacks 36, Wales 22‚Ä¢ 2016 ‚Äì All Blacks 39, Wales 21‚Ä¢ 2014 ‚Äì All Blacks 34, Wales 16 At the RWC ‚Ä¢ 2003 Pool D ‚Äì All Blacks 53, Wales 37‚Ä¢ 1995 Pool C ‚Äì All Blacks 35, Wales 9‚Ä¢ 1987 semifinal ‚Äì All Blacks 49, Wales 6 This article first appeared on nzherald.co.nz and was republished with permission. —Ç–∞–π–Ω—ã–π –±–∞–Ω–∫–µ—Ç –¥–ª—è¬†—Å–∞–º—ã—Ö –±–ª–∏–∑–∫–∏—Ö –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –í–µ—á–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–∞ –≤¬†–ü–∞—Ä–∏–∂–µ. –î–∞—Ä—å—è –≤¬†—Ç–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∏ –ª–µ—Ç –±—ã–ª–∞ –∂–µ–Ω–æ–π __label__sport Deodhar Trophy: India C hammer India A to enter final RANCHI: Openers Shubman Gill and Mayank Agarwal smashed spectacular hundreds before Jalaj Saxena took a career-best seven-wicket haul, steering India C into the final of the Deodhar Trophy with a massive 232-run win over India A on Friday. India C skipper Gill (143 off 142) and Test opener Agarwal (120 off 111) shared a 226-run stand before a special knock from Suryakumar Yadav (72 not out off 29) propelled the team to 366 for three in 50 overs. India A were never in the chase and off-spinner Saxena (7/41) ran through their batting line-up with a memorable spell. It was India A's second successive defeat in as many days, knocking them out of the tournament. India C and India B, who beat India A on Thursday, will play the final on Monday. Before the title clash, they meet each other in the final league game on Saturday. India C effectively batted India A out of the game with Agarwal and Gill piling up the runs. Gill, who was part of the India Test squad for the home series against South Africa but did not get a game, hammered as many as half a dozen sixes besides 10 fours on way to his highest score in List A cricket. Agarwal carried his stellar form in Test cricket into the 50-over format, collecting 15 fours and a six. Following the openers' double century stand, Suryakumar got into the act and showed why he is considered as a dangerous white-ball batsman. The Mumbai cricketer clobbered nine fours and four sixes in his exhilarating knock, providing a perfect finish to India C innings.
__label__society –í –ü–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º –±—ã–ª–∏ –æ–±—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª—ã, —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–æ–π—Å–∫ –æ—Ç–∫–ª–∞–¥—ñ–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è ‚Äì –ú–∏–Ω–æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã –í –ü–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º 30 –æ–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä—è –∑–∞—Ñ–∏–∫—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –æ–±—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª—ã, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–∏–ª –∏ —Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–º —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∫–µ 4 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è –Ω–µ –Ω–∞—á–Ω–µ—Ç—Å—è. –ò—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫: –∑–∞—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã –ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ—è –ó–∞–≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—é–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –±—Ä–∏—Ñ–∏–Ω–≥–µ –≤ –ø—è—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü—É –≤ –ö–∏–µ–≤–µ –ü—Ä—è–º–∞—è —Ä–µ—á—å: ``–î–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –æ–±—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª—ã –±—ã–ª–∏, –∏ –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –º—ã –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—ã —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –º—ã –∂–¥–µ–º 7 –¥–Ω–µ–π –æ—Ç –æ–±—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª–æ–≤``. –î–µ—Ç–∞–ª–∏: –û–Ω —É—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –æ–±—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–ª—ã –±—ã–ª–∏ –∑–∞—Ñ–∏–∫—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã 30 –æ–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä—è. –ù–∞–∫–∞–Ω—É–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ó–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –∑–∞—è–≤–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –ü–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º –Ω–∞—á–Ω–µ—Ç—Å—è 4 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è, –ø—Ä–∏ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏–∏ —Å–æ–±–ª—é–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–µ–º–∏–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º–∞ —Ç–∏—à–∏–Ω—ã. –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É —ç—Ç–æ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ: –†–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–∏–ª –≤ –ó–æ–ª–æ—Ç–æ–º –∏ –ü–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º –æ–¥–Ω–æ –∏–∑ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏–π –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –≤ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–¥—Å–∫–æ–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –≤—ã—Å—à–µ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ. –ü—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã –∏ –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä –∏–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–µ–ª –Ω–∞–¥–µ—é—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä–µ. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –≤ –ó–æ–ª–æ—Ç–æ–º 29 –æ–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä—è –ó–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π —Ä–∞–∑–≥–æ–≤–∞—Ä–∏–≤–∞–ª —Å –∫–∞–Ω—Ü–ª–µ—Ä–æ–º –ì–µ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ê–Ω–≥–µ–ª–æ–π –ú–µ—Ä–∫–µ–ª—å. –ü—Ä–µ—Å—Å-—Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∞—Ä—å –ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –†–§ –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –ü–µ—Å–∫–æ–≤ –æ—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ ``–Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–¥—Å–∫–æ–π –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏``¬†¬†–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏—Ç –æ—Ç –ü—É—Ç–∏–Ω–∞ –Ω–µ –≤ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω—é—é –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥—å. –õ–∏–¥–µ—Ä—ã ``—á–µ—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∏``: –ó–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π, –ú–µ—Ä–∫–µ–ª—å, –ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –†–§ –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ü—É—Ç–∏–Ω, –ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –≠–º–º–∞–Ω—é—ç–ª—å –ú–∞–∫—Ä–æ–Ω. –ß–∏—Ç–∞–π—Ç–µ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ:¬†–ü—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–π–∫–æ: ``–Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–¥—Å–∫–∞—è –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞`` –≤ –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä–µ ‚Äì –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π —à–∞–Ω—Å ``–ú–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞`` –ü—Ä–µ–¥—ã—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è: –ó–Ω–∞—Ç—å –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ:–£–π—Ç–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—Å—è. –ü–æ–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ª–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤–æ–π—Å–∫ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—á–∏—Ç—å –≤–æ–π–Ω—É –Ω–∞ –î–æ–Ω–±–∞—Å—Å–µ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –®—Ç–∞–π–Ω–º–∞–π–µ—Ä–∞: –∫–∞–∫ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –∏–¥–µ—é –ö—Ä–µ–º–ª—è –±–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π –¥–ª—è –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—ã
__label__society Joint Turkish and Russian patrols begin in Syrian region SEVIMLI, Turkey¬†(AP) - Turkey and Russia launched joint patrols Friday in northeastern Syria, under a deal that halted a Turkish offensive against Syrian Kurdish fighters who were forced to withdraw from the border area following Ankara's incursion. The patrols will cover two sections, in the west and east of Turkey's operation zone in Syria, with a depth of 10 kilometers (6 miles). Turkish troops and allied Syrian opposition fighters now control the border towns of Tal Abyad, Ras al-Ayn and nearby villages. The deal on the patrols excludes the city of Qamishli, according to the ministry's statement on Tuesday. Turkey's defense ministry tweeted on Friday that the patrols started in al-Darbasiyah region, with Turkish and Russian troops, armored vehicles and drones. The Russian Defense Ministry said the joint patrol consists of nine military vehicles, including a Russian armored personnel carrier, and would cover a 110-kilometer (68-mile) route on Friday. The joint patrols did not fly Russian and Turkish flags on their armored vehicles on Friday. An Associated Press journalist at the Turkey-Syria border could see the Syrian flag hoisted on a building on the Syrian side. Syrian government troops moved into Kurdish-held areas following an agreement in October. Turkey last month invaded northeastern Syria to push out Syrian Kurdish fighters whom it considers terrorists for their links to a Kurdish insurgency inside Turkey. But the U.S. had partnered with the Syrian Kurdish fighters, their top allies in the war against the Islamic State group. The relationship has strained ties between Washington and Ankara who are NATO allies. After an abrupt and widely criticized decision by President Donald Trump to withdraw American troops from this part of Syria, the Kurdish forces approached the Syrian government and Russia for protection. Syrian government troops and Russian military police subsequently moved into areas along the border. Two ceasefire agreements -brokered by the U.S. and Russia- paused Turkey's operation to allow the Syrian Kurdish fighters withdraw 30 kilometers (about 19 miles, away from the border. Russia told Turkey, at the end of the 150-hour cease-fire on Tuesday, that the Syrian Kurdish fighters were out of the strip of territory, as well as out of the towns of Manbij and Tal Rifaat, west of the Euphrates River. Also Friday, Turkey's defense ministry announced that a Turkish soldier was killed after an improvised explosive device detonated on Thursday, bringing the Turkish military's death toll to 13 since the start Ankara's invasion in northeastern Syria on Oct. 9. Mortars fired from Syria during the early phases of the operation killed 21 civilians in Turkey. Though the truce has mostly held, it has been marred by accusations of violations from both sides and occasional clashes. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has threatened to resume the offensive if deemed necessary. ___ Associated Press writers Zeynep Bilginsoy in Istanbul and Vladimir Isachenkov in Moscow contributed to this report.
__label__society –ê–≤–∞—Ä–∏–π–Ω—ã–π SSJ 100 —Å–µ–ª –≤ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω–∏ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞. 1 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è. INTERFAX.RU - –ü–∞—Å—Å–∞–∂–∏—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π —Å–∞–º–æ–ª–µ—Ç Superjet 100, —É –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã —Å –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–º, –ø—Ä–∏–∑–µ–º–ª–∏–ª—Å—è –≤ –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É ``–†–æ—â–∏–Ω–æ`` –≤ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω–∏. –≠—Ç—É –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é –ø–æ–¥—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–¥–∏–ª–∏ –≤ –ú–ß–° –†–§. –†–∞–Ω–µ–µ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–ª–æ—Å—å, —á—Ç–æ —É —Å–∞–º–æ–ª–µ—Ç–∞, –≤—ã–ª–µ—Ç–µ–≤—à–µ–≥–æ –≤ –°–∞–Ω–∫—Ç-–ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥ –∏–∑ —Ç—é–º–µ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞ ``–†–æ—â–∏–Ω–æ``, –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–∑ –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π. –°–∏–≥–Ω–∞–ª –±–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è —Å–∞–º–æ–ª—ë—Ç –Ω–µ –ø–æ–¥–∞–≤–∞–ª. –ù–∞ –±–æ—Ä—Ç—É –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è 80 –ø–∞—Å—Å–∞–∂–∏—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ —à–µ—Å—Ç—å —á–ª–µ–Ω–æ–≤ —ç–∫–∏–ø–∞–∂–∞. –ù–µ—à—Ç–∞—Ç–Ω–∞—è —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–æ—à–ª–∞ —Å –ª–∞–π–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–º –∞–≤–∏–∞–∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ ``–Ø–º–∞–ª``. –ü–æ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞ Flightradar, —Å–∞–º–æ–ª–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω –¥–≤–∞ –≥–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥.
__label__entertainment From Halloween to Taelloween : Fans showcase creativity as edits of BTS V went viral on Twitter Each year, Halloween becomes a venue of how creative stan culture can result in truly wondrous things. Even before the actual festivity began, BTS fans have shown excitement and anticipation to show off their innovativeness, especially with¬†BTS V as their favorite subject.¬† 5 Years ago, fans remembered that in one Bangtan bomb, BTS V dressed as The¬† Joker. And now¬†in 2019, this fan-made video went viral on Twitter¬†for seemingly telling the story of his 'transformation'.¬† A few days after¬†this edit went viral, fans started the #Taelloween event, showcasing edited¬†photos and video of BTS V. This one showed him as The Joker too, but¬†his fake gum chewing really added to the effect! This one looked so realistic, creepy yet sexy at the same time And then we have ``Goth Taehyung`` Fans even went as far as changing the icon to ``Taerleyquin`` or Harlequin as part of the celebration Even the famous chocolate brand @LindtUK couldn't escape the fun The highlight of the excitement of the event peaked when BTS¬† uploaded videos through Tiktok wishing (and scaring) fans Happy Halloween with edited videos and proving they are not behind when it comes to fun and imagination. Halloween proves to be a¬†great opportunity for fans to show their ingenuity and an immersive atmosphere to create different ideas and make it into tangible reality, and Taelloween is no exception. We're excited to see what's in store next year!
__label__society –ú–ò–î –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏: –ù–ê–¢–û ``–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ—Ü–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç —Ä–∞—Å–∫–æ–ª`` –≤ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–µ –í –ú–ò–î –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –æ–±–≤–∏–Ω–∏–ª–∏ –ù–ê–¢–û –≤ –æ–±–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Ä–∞—Å–∫–æ–ª–∞ –≤ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –≤–∏–∑–∏—Ç–∞ –°–µ–≤–µ—Ä–æ–∞—Ç–ª–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ç–∞ –ê–ª—å—è–Ω—Å–∞ –≤ –ö–∏–µ–≤ –∏ –û–¥–µ—Å—Å—É. –û–± —ç—Ç–æ–º –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–∏ –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ü—ã –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ú–∞—Ä–∏–∏ –ó–∞—Ö–∞—Ä–æ–≤–æ–π, –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–π—Ç–µ –≤–µ–¥–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –≤ –ø—è—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü—É, 1 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è. ``–û–ø—è—Ç—å –Ω–∞—Ç–æ–≤—Ü—ã –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ä—è–≤–ª—è—é—Ç –≤ –∞–¥—Ä–µ—Å –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä –Ω–∏—á–µ–º –Ω–µ –æ–±–æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–µ—Ç–µ–Ω–∑–∏–π –∏ –æ–±–≤–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π. –ü—ã—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∏–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç—å –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏—É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª–∏–∫—Ç, –ø–æ–¥–∞–≤–∞—è –µ–≥–æ –∫–∞–∫ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª–∏–∫—Ç —Å –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–µ–π``, - –∑–∞—è–≤–∏–ª–∞ –ó–∞—Ö–∞—Ä–æ–≤–∞. –û–Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏–ª–∞, —á—Ç–æ –ê–ª—å—è–Ω—Å –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–µ—Ç ``–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å–µ–±—è –¥–µ—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–º–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –∞ –Ω–∞ –æ–±–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ``, –∞ –µ–≥–æ —à–∞–≥–∏ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–∏—é –≥—Ä–∞–¥—É—Å–∞ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ ``–ø—É—Ç–µ–º –æ–±–µ—â–∞–Ω–∏–π —É–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω—Ü–∞–º —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ ``–ù–ê–¢–û –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à–µ–π —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–µ``. ``–° —É—á–µ—Ç–æ–º –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –ê–ª—å—è–Ω—Å–∞ –∏ –µ–≥–æ¬† –≥—É–º–∞–Ω–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–≤–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–π`` –ø—Ä–∏–∑—ã–≤—ã –∫ –ö–∏–µ–≤—É –∏–¥—Ç–∏ –≤ –µ–≤—Ä–æ–∞—Ç–ª–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –æ–±—ä—è—Ç–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ—Ü–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç —Ä–∞—Å–∫–æ–ª —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—ã, —É–≥–ª—É–±–ª—è—é—Ç –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ª–∏–Ω–∏–∏ –≤ –ï–≤—Ä–æ–ø–µ, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç —Ä–æ—Å—Ç—É –º–µ–∂—ç—Ç–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–æ—Ä–µ—á–∏–π``, - –∑–∞—è–≤–∏–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ü–∞ –ú–ò–î –†–§. –û–Ω–∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ–±–≤–∏–Ω–∏–ª–∞ –ê–ª—å—è–Ω—Å –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω ``—Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –ª–æ–≥–∏–∫–æ–π ``—Ö–æ–ª–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –≤–æ–π–Ω—ã``, –∏–∑-–∑–∞ —á–µ–≥–æ, –ø–æ –µ–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º, –ù–ê–¢–û –∏ –†–§ –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å—Å—è –∫ –ø—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–µ–º—É —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–ª–æ—Å—å, –Ω–∞–∫–∞–Ω—É–Ω–µ –≤ –ö–∏–µ–≤–µ –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–∏–ª–æ—Å—å –∑–∞—Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –°–µ–≤–µ—Ä–æ–∞—Ç–ª–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞–ª—å—è–Ω—Å–∞, –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ¬†—Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–ª–æ—Å—å –∑–∞—Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ö–æ–º–∏—Å—Å–∏–∏ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–∞-–ù–ê–¢–û, –ø–æ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∞–º –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–æ¬†—Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –∑–∞—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ.
__label__society Honduras joins El Salvador in obtaining protected status extension in U.S TEGUCIGALPA (Reuters) - The U.S. government has extended temporary protection for Hondurans living in the United States by a year, Honduran officials said on Friday, following a similar extension for Salvadorans in a rollback of U.S. plans to end the program. U.S. President Donald Trump last year said he would shut down temporary protected status (TPS) for Hondurans and Salvadorans after a January 2020 expiration, amid a slew of measures meant to crack down on growing numbers of migrants from Central America. ‚ÄúOn our part, we will keep working to find a permanent and humane solution for our Honduran brothers,‚Äù Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez said in a Tweet on Friday, adding that TPS covers more than 40,000 Hondurans. The TPS program offers protection from deportation to immigrants who already are in the United States, including those who entered illegally, from countries affected by natural disasters, civil conflicts and other problems. Honduras became eligible in 1999 following the devastation of Hurricane Mitch, while El Salvador joined after two destructive earthquakes in 2001.
__label__society Trump Fires Up Religious Critics With Job for Televangelist WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî The ascension of Paula White as an official member of Donald Trump‚Äôs White House highlights how closely the president is relying on his inner circle of evangelical Christian supporters as he fights an impeachment probe during his reelection bid ‚Äî while giving liberal evangelicals a new opening to push back at his administration‚Äôs mingling of religion and policymaking. White is a televangelist who has sparked division among fellow Christians over her association with the so-called ‚Äúprosperity gospel,‚Äù an assertion that God rewards believers with personal as well as financial success. She‚Äôs also frequently identified as personal minister to the president and is now set to become an adviser heading Trump‚Äôs Faith and Opportunity Initiative, according to a White House official. In some ways, White‚Äôs new position only formalizes her long-standing influence in the White House. The 53-year-old has known Trump for more than 15 years and frequently meets with the president alongside fellow evangelical Christian advisers, including a White House visit this week where the group laid hands on Trump in prayer. But White is a more contentious figure within her faith than other pro-Trump evangelicals and was the subject of a years-long investigation into her finances by Iowa Republican Sen. Chuck Grassley. That profile makes White, who uses her married name White-Cain, a compelling symbol for liberal Christians who are making an increasingly vocal appeal to religious Americans who do not align with Trump‚Äôs broader political agenda. ‚ÄúThe rise of the religious left has been given a shot in the arm every time Trump doubles down on his white evangelical base,‚Äù said Guthrie Graves-Fitzsimmons, a religious activist on the left who created an anti-Trump network called The Resistance Prays. ‚ÄúYes, he may score short term political points. But in the long term, he really is energizing and mobilizing this whole swath of people who are religious and are astonished by what‚Äôs happening with the Paula Whites of the world.‚Äù Jonathan Wilson-Hartgrove, a liberal evangelical preacher who works with the progressive group Red Letter Christians, said White‚Äôs use of her ministry ‚Äúto exploit the poor ‚Ä¶ should be of real concern to all people of faith.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhile we often frame religion in public life as progressives to conservatives, it‚Äôs important to say that even within that frame, Paula White is an extremist and always has been,‚Äù Wilson-Hartgrove said. The White House role for White, whose ministry did not immediately return an interview request, was first reported by The New York Times. White distanced herself from the prosperity gospel in a 2017 statement that said she would ‚Äúreject any theology that doesn‚Äôt affirm or acknowledge the entirety of scriptural teaching about God‚Äôs presence and blessing in suffering as much as in times of prosperity.‚Äù The Florida-based White‚Äôs website features a pitch for followers to purchase a $130 ‚ÄúFavor Seed‚Äù in order to help battle ‚Äúan enemy of debt, depression, a job, or a health issue prevailing against you.‚Äù The White House initiative she will advise was created by the Trump administration last year to help faith-based groups partner with the federal government. White‚Äôs advisory role, according to the executive order setting up the initiative, empowers her to suggest ‚Äúchanges to policies, programs, and practices that affect the delivery of services by faith-based and community organizations.‚Äù Beyond White‚Äôs new position, Trump‚Äôs meeting this week with his closest conservative evangelical supporters included some discussion of how they would try to energize their contacts on the president‚Äôs behalf, according to attendee Tony Perkins of the Family Research Council. Perkins said that while the Tuesday meeting with Trump was not entirely ‚Äúa planning session,‚Äù attendees did perform ‚Äúa quick inventory‚Äù of their own networks to determine what ‚Äúwe can do‚Äù to help the president. ‚ÄúSeveral of us have daily radio programs and some of us have TV programs and some of (us) lead very large churches and ministries,‚Äù Perkins said. ‚ÄúIt was more looking around the room and how do we be more intentional about getting this out there and using the platforms that we already have.‚Äù ‚Äî By ELANA SCHOR and AAMER MADHANI Associated Press Associated Press religion coverage receives support from the Lilly Endowment through the Religion News Foundation. The AP is solely responsible for this content. Return To Top Copyright ¬© 2019 courthousenews.com
__label__society UN expert: Treatment of Assange putting his life ‚Äòat risk‚Äô GENEVA, Nov 1 ‚Äî The treatment of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, who is facing the threat of extradition from Britain to the US on espionage charges, is putting his life ‚Äúat risk‚Äù, an independent UN rights expert said today. ‚ÄúUnless the UK urgently changes course and alleviates his inhumane situation, Mr. Assange‚Äôs continued exposure to arbitrariness and abuse may soon end up costing his life,‚Äù the UN special rapporteur on torture and other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment, Nils Melzer, said in a statement. Melzer, who visited the 48-year-old Australian whistleblower in a London prison on May 9, nearly a month after his arrest at Ecuador‚Äôs embassy where he had been holed up for seven years, has previously warned he was being subjected to drawn-out ‚Äúpsychological torture‚Äù. A spokesperson told AFP that the independent expert, who does not speak on behalf of the United Nations, had not met Assange since then but had received ‚Äúupdates‚Äù about his condition. Today‚Äôs statement warned that Assange‚Äôs health had continued to deteriorate since his arrest, stressing that ‚Äúhis life was now at risk.‚Äù In the statement, Melzer pointed out that in May he had demanded immediate measures to protect the WikiLeaks founder‚Äôs health and dignity. ‚ÄúHowever, what we have seen from the UK Government is outright contempt for Mr. Assange‚Äôs rights and integrity,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúDespite the medical urgency of my appeal, and the seriousness of the alleged violations, the UK has not undertaken any measures of investigation, prevention and redress required under international law,‚Äù he charged. Assange ‚Äúcontinues to be detained under oppressive conditions of isolation and surveillance, not justified by his detention status,‚Äù he said. His statement pointed out that Assange had completed his prison sentence for violating his British bail terms in 2012 and was now ‚Äúbeing held exclusively in relation to the pending extradition request from the United States.‚Äù Assange is facing the extradition request by the US over charges he violated the US Espionage Act by publishing a huge cache of military and diplomatic files in 2010.¬† ‚ÄúWhile the US Government prosecutes Mr. Assange for publishing information about serious human rights violations, including torture and murder, the officials responsible for these crimes continue to enjoy impunity,‚Äù Melzer said. He also decried that ‚Äúdespite the complexity of the proceedings against him led by the world‚Äôs most powerful Government, Mr Assange‚Äôs access to legal counsel and documents has been severely obstructed.‚Äù This, he said, had effectively undermined ‚Äúhis most fundamental right to prepare his defence.‚Äù In his appeal, Melzer urged London to bar Assange‚Äôs extradition to the US, and demanded that ‚Äúhe be promptly released and allowed to recover his health and rebuild his personal and professional life.‚Äù ‚Äî AFP

—Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–ª–∏ –≥–æ—Å–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º—É ¬´–Æ—Å—Ç–∏—Ü–∏—è –∏ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–∫–∞¬ª. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–æ–º –∑–∞—Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å–µ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–º –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏—è–º –∏ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—é –∏–∑–≥–æ—Ç–∞–≤–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ–º–æ–π –∏–º–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∏–ª –∏.–æ. –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ —é—Å—Ç–∏—Ü–∏–∏, –≤ –ö–æ–º–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—é. –î–ª—è –∏—Ö —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å—É–¥–æ–≤ –ø–æ-–ø—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–µ–º—É –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ–º–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–π. –ò –µ—Å–ª–∏, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –≤ –í—É–∫—Ç—ã–ª–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∞, —Ç–æ –≤ –°—ã–∫—Ç—ã–≤–∫–∞—Ä–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ ¬´–ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º¬ª —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–∏. –ó–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –≥–¥–µ –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å —Å—É–¥–µ–π, —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫ –≤—ã—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª –Ω–∞ —Ç–æ—Ä–≥–∏. –ß—Ç–æ–±—ã —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—É, –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —á–∏—Å–ª–∞ —Å—É–¥–µ–π –∏ —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∏ –º–µ–∂–¥—É –Ω–∏–º–∏. –ì–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–æ–≤–µ—â–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏ –æ –ø–æ–¥—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∫–æ–≤–æ–π –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ß–∞—â–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–ª–µ—Ç–Ω–∏–µ –∫—Ä–∞–¥—É—Ç –µ–¥—É –∏ —Å–ª–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ª–µ—Ç–æ–º ‚Äì –≤–µ–ª–æ—Å–∏–ø–µ–¥—ã. –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å–µ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å –∫–æ–º–∏—Å—Å–∏–∏ –ø–æ —Ä–µ–≥–ª–∞–º–µ–Ω—Ç—É –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ñ–∞—Ä–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª –ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –º–æ–ª–æ–¥–µ–∂–∏ –≤ –ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Ä—É—Å–ª–æ: –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª–µ–∫–∞—Ç—å –∏—Ö –∫ —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É, –æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç—å –≤ –°–ú–ò –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ–π —Å–∞–º–æ—Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –í —Ö–æ–¥–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ —Å–æ–≤–µ—â–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ–±—Å—É–¥–∏–ª–∏ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤—ã—Ç—Ä–µ–∑–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π. –ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –∑–¥—Ä–∞–≤–æ–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –ö–æ–º–∏ –î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏—è –ë–µ—Ä–µ–∑–∏–Ω–∞, –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –ø–∞—Ü–∏–µ–Ω—Ç —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è —Ä–µ—Å–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π –∫–∞–∑–Ω–µ, —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥—ã –ø–æ –µ–≥–æ —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏—é —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ 20 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π –≤ —Å—É—Ç–∫–∏. –û–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ –æ–Ω –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ –¥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–∞ –≥–æ–¥–∞ –≤ –°—ã–∫—Ç—ã–≤–∫–∞—Ä–µ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã –ø—è—Ç—å –∫–æ–µ–∫ –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑–µ –Ω–∞—Ä–∫–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –¥–∏—Å–ø–∞–Ω—Å–µ—Ä–∞.

–∑–∞–∫–ª—é—á–∏–≤ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∫—É —Å–æ —Å–ª–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º. –ö–∞–∫ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞–µ—Ç 1 –Ω–æ—è–±—Ä—è –∞–¥–≤–æ–∫–∞—Ç –ü–æ–¥–∫–∏–Ω–∞ –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä –ú–µ–ª–µ—à–∫–æ, –µ–≥–æ 69-–ª–µ—Ç–Ω–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω–≤–æ–µ–º ‚Äî —É –Ω–µ–≥–æ —Å–ª—É—á–∏–ª—Å—è –≥–∏–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∫—Ä–∏–∑. –û–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω—ë–Ω–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å-—Å–ª—É–∂–±–∞ —Å—É–¥–æ–≤ –ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥–∞ –ø–∏—à–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ, –ø–æ —Ñ–∏–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –¥–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä —Å—É–±–ø–æ–¥—Ä—è–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–±—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ä–µ–∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—ã—Ö –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –≤ —É—Ñ–∏–º—Å–∫–æ–º –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É. –ó–∞—Ç–µ–º –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π, –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–∏—Å–ª–∏–≤ 8 280 414 —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π –Ω–∞ —Ä–∞—Å—á—ë—Ç–Ω—ã–π —Å—á—ë—Ç, –≤ —Ç–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Ç—É–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞—é—Ç, —á—Ç–æ, –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞—è—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–µ, –æ–Ω –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —É–Ω–∏—á—Ç–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –±–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å –∏–ª–∏ –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω—ã –¥–µ–∫–∞–±—Ä—è. –ê–¥–≤–æ–∫–∞—Ç –ü–æ–¥–∫–∏–Ω–∞ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª, —á—Ç–æ –µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–¥–∑–∞—â–∏—Ç–Ω—ã–π –≤–∏–Ω—É –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–ª, –∞ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è —Å–ª–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ª–∏—à—å –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö –ø–æ–¥—Ä—è–¥—á–∏–∫–∞, 34-–ª–µ—Ç–Ω–µ–≥–æ —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è ¬´–¢—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –°–ü–±¬ª –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ—è –ú–∏—Ä–æ–Ω–æ–≤–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –Ω–µ –ø–æ–º–Ω–∏—Ç, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞–≤–∞–ª —Å–µ–º—å –º–∏–ª–ª–∏–æ–Ω–æ–≤, –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç —Å–∞–º —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç. –ù–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω–∏–º, –∫ –ü–æ–¥–∫–∏–Ω—É –∏ –ú–∏—Ä–æ–Ω–æ–≤—É –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –ø–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥—Å–∫–æ–π —ç–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –ø–æ–ª–∏—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–∏—à–ª–∏ —É—Ç—Ä–æ–º 30 –æ–∫—Ç—è–±—Ä—è. ¬´–õ–µ–Ω–∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç¬ª –∏ ¬´–¢—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç¬ª –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ—Ä–∞—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã, –≤ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–º –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–æ–≤. –£ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –≤ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∞—Ç—Å—è –ø–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥—Å–∫–æ–µ –ü—É–ª–∫–æ–≤–æ, –µ–∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–±—É—Ä–≥—Å–∫–æ–µ –ö–æ–ª—å—Ü–æ–≤–æ, –ö—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ä, –°–æ—á–∏ –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ –≤–æ–∑–¥—É—à–Ω—ã–µ –≥–∞–≤–∞–Ω–∏. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã ¬´–õ–µ–Ω–∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞¬ª –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª–∏—Å—å —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ–π –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∏–Ω—Ñ—Ä–∞—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –∫–æ—Å–º–æ–¥—Ä–æ–º–∞ –í–æ—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã–π. ¬´–¢—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç¬ª –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏–ª —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤–æ –í–Ω—É–∫–æ–≤–æ-3, –°–∏–º—Ñ–µ—Ä–æ–ø–æ–ª–µ, –°–∞—Ä–∞—Ç–æ–≤–µ, –í–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–µ–∂–µ. –í –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞—Ö —ç—Ç–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª–∞ —Å ¬´–õ–µ–Ω–∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–º¬ª.
__label__society –†–ê–ú–ó–ê–ù –ö–ê–î–´–†–û–í –ü–û–ó–î–†–ê–í–ò–õ –†–ê–ë–û–¢–ù–ò–ö–û–í –§–°–°–ü –° –ü–†–û–§–ï–°–°–ò–û–ù–ê–õ–¨–ù–´–ú –ü–†–ê–ó–î–ù–ò–ö–û–ú –°–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â—É—é –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å—å –ì–ª–∞–≤–∞ –ß–µ—á–µ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π –†–µ—Å–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏–ª –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ü–µ –≤ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Å–µ—Ç–∏ –í–ö. ¬´–Ø –ø–æ–∑–¥—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—é —Å —ç—Ç–∏–º –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–º —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è –£–§–°–°–ü –†–§ –ø–æ –ß–µ—á–µ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π –†–µ—Å–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–µ - –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ c—É–¥–µ–±–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞ –ß–† –ê–±–¥—É–ª—É –ê–ª–∞—É–¥–∏–Ω–æ–≤–∞ –∏ –≤–µ—Å—å –ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–π —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤ –≤–µ–¥–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –£–§–°–°–ü –†–§ –ø–æ –ß–† —Å –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ —Å–≤–æ–µ–≥–æ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–µ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã¬ª, - –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª –æ–Ω.¬† –†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å —Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ —Å—É–¥–µ–±–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–≤—ã –¥–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—é—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏ –æ–±—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–º –∏ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Å–ª—É–∂–µ–±–Ω–æ–º—É –¥–æ–ª–≥—É. ¬´–ù–∞ –Ω–∏—Ö –≤–æ–∑–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∞ –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω–∞—è –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—é –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å—É–¥–æ–≤, –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—é —Å—É–¥–µ–±–Ω—ã—Ö –∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ —Ä—è–¥ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á. –ñ–µ–ª–∞—é —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫—Ä–µ–ø–∫–æ–≥–æ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å—è, —É—Å–ø–µ—Ö–æ–≤ –∏ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—è!¬ª, - –∑–∞–∫–ª—é—á–∏–ª –ö–∞–¥—ã—Ä–æ–≤.
__label__society –≠–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∫–ª—É–± –ï–∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–±—É—Ä–≥–∞ –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª –æ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –†—É–Ω–µ—Ç–∞ –ù–∞ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–≤—à–µ–º—Å—è –Ω–∞–∫–∞–Ω—É–Ω–µ –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–æ—â–∞–¥–∫–µ –°–≤–µ—Ä–¥–ª–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –¥–æ–º–∞ –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –∑–∞—Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏–∏ ¬´–≠–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–ª—É–±–∞ –ï–∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–±—É—Ä–≥–∞¬ª –±—ã–ª–∞ –∂–∏–≤–∞—è –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏—è. –ß—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —É–¥–∏–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ. –¢–µ–º–∞ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–∞—Å–∞–ª–∞—Å—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–∞. –ì–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∏ –æ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –≤ –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–µ, –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞–µ—Ç –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ—Å–ø–æ–Ω–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –ù–∞–∫–∞–Ω—É–Ω–µ.RU. –†—è–¥ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π, –∫–∞—Å–∞—é—â–∏—Ö—Å—è –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–µ, —É–∂–µ –≤—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏–ª–∏ –≤ —Å–∏–ª—É –≤–µ—Å–Ω–æ–π —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞, –æ–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ, –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–π –ø–æ–∫–∞ –Ω–µ—Ç, –∞ –µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –æ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—ã –Ω–µ —Ä–µ—à–∞—é—Ç –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á. –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏–∏ —É–±–µ–∂–¥–µ–Ω—ã, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω—ã —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è —Ç–µ –∂–µ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—ã, —á—Ç–æ –∏ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ. –ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å—ã, –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏–≤—à–∏—Ö –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–æ—â–∞–¥–∫–µ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–∞–º–∏, –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É-—Ç–æ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω—É—é —Å–∏–ª—É: –±—ã–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–µ—Ü–µ–¥–µ–Ω—Ç—ã, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Å—É–¥ –≤—ã–Ω–æ—Å–∏–ª —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ –≤–∏–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –°–ú–ò –∑–∞ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤—É –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª–æ–≤, –æ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ª–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥, –µ—â–µ –¥–æ –≤—Å—Ç—É–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ —Å–∏–ª—É –ø–æ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–∫, –∫–∞—Å–∞—é—â–∏—Ö—Å—è –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–µ. –¢–∞—Ç—å—è–Ω–∞ –ù–∏–∫–æ–ª–∞–µ–≤–∞, —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –†–ò–ê ``–ù–∞–∫–∞–Ω—É–Ω–µ.RU`` —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∞: ``–•–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å –±—ã, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω –Ω–µ –∏–º–µ–ª –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–π —Å–∏–ª—ã. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –°–ú–ò, –∫ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—É, –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–ª–∏ –ª—é–±—ã—Ö –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –≤–µ—â–µ–π, –±—ã–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç—ã –≤ 2018 –≥–æ–¥—É, —Ç–æ –¥–∞–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ –æ—Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å —É—á–µ—Ç–æ–º —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª –≤—ã—à–µ–ª –≤ 2018 –≥–æ–¥—É. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –∂–µ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª –±—ã–ª –æ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω –≤ 2001 –≥–æ–¥—É –∏–ª–∏ –≤ 2016, –¥–∞–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏–≤, –∏ –Ω–µ –Ω–∞–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –°–ú–ò –∑–∞ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—ã, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤—ã—à–ª–∏ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ª–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥``. –û–ª—å–≥–∞ –ú–∏—Ö–∞–π–ª–æ–≤–∞, –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä ``–í–µ—á–µ—Ä–Ω–∏—Ö –≤–µ–¥–æ–º–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π`` –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏–ª–∞: ``–ó–∞–¥–∞—á–∞ –°–ú–ò ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∞—è –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è. –õ—é–±–æ–µ –°–ú–ò —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é. –¢–µ, –∫—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º —Å –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–º –æ—Å–≤–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–æ–±—ã—Ç–∏–π, –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, —Å–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –≥–æ—Ä—è—á–∞—è –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç—å –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –∏–Ω–æ–π, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–∞—é—Ç –ø–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ, –æ —á–µ–º –º—ã —É–∑–Ω–∞–ª–∏ –≤–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–µ, —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –û–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –º—ã –±—É–¥–µ–º –∂–¥–∞—Ç—å, —á–µ–º –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω—á–∏—Ç—Å—è, –≤—ã–¥–∞—Ç—å –µ–µ –≤ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–µ–≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ, –æ–Ω–∞ —É–∂–µ –∫ —Ç–æ–º—É –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–π–¥–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ —Å–æ—Ü—Å–µ—Ç—è–º``. –û–ª–µ–≥ –û—Ä–ª–æ–≤, –∑–∞–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ –†–ò–ê ``–§–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞–ª-–ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å`` –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–ª –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥ –∏ –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —É—Ä–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –†–æ—Å–∫–æ–º–Ω–∞–¥–∑–æ—Ä–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π, –∫ —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –≤ –ø–æ–¥–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–µ–º –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ–≤ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏–µ –°–ú–ò –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –ø–æ–º–æ—â–∏. –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –°–∞–ª—ã–≥–∏–Ω, —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å —Ñ–∏–ª–∏–∞–ª–∞ ``–†–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–π –≥–∞–∑–µ—Ç—ã`` –≤ –£—Ä–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–º –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–µ, –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥–∏–ª –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –°–ú–ò –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤ —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–∞–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞ —Ü–∏—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏–Ω—ã—Ö –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –Ω–æ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª –æ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å–∞–º–∏–º —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ü–∏—è–º —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞ –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ú–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—ã –æ—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤, —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å, —Ç–∞–∫ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å, –Ω–∞–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –°–ú–ò, –Ω–∞–¥–∑–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ã –∏ —Å—É–¥ –≤–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –±—ã –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª–µ–∫–∞—Ç—å —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ. –ö–∞–∫ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª —é—Ä–∏—Å—Ç –ò–≤–∞–Ω –ö–∞–¥–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤, –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –ª—é–¥–∏ –∏–∑ –Ω–∞–¥–∑–æ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–µ–¥–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤ –≤–µ—Å—å–º–∞ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä—Ö–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—ã —Å —Ç–µ–º, –∫–∞–∫ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç ¬´–≤—Å–µ–º–∏—Ä–Ω–∞—è –ø–∞—É—Ç–∏–Ω–∞¬ª –∏ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-—Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–æ–≤. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –≤—ã—Ö–æ–¥–æ–º –¥–ª—è –≤—ã–Ω–µ—Å–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –æ—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–≤. –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –†–æ—Å–∫–æ–º–Ω–∞–¥–∑–æ—Ä—É –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º –≤–µ–¥–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–∞–º —Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –≤—ã–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Ä–∞–∑—ä—è—Å–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –±—ã –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏–ª–∏ –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∞–º –∏–∑–±–µ–≥–∞—Ç—å –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –∏ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–º–µ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–π, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∫ –±–ª–æ–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–µ —Å–∞–π—Ç–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–∞ –£—Ä–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–π –∞—Å—Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –¶–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä —ç—Ç–Ω–æ–∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π, –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏–ª–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ —ç–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∏–∑–º–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –∏–¥–µ–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–æ—Ä–∏–∑–º–∞, –¥–æ—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –∫–∞—Ñ–µ–¥—Ä—ã –∞—Ä—Ö–µ–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –∏ —ç—Ç–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –£—Ä–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∞ –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ—è –°—Ç–∞—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–∞, –Ω—É–∂–Ω–∞ —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ—Å–≤–µ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å–∫–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞. –ù—É–∂–Ω–æ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω—è—Ç—å –¥–µ—Ç—è–º –∏ –≤–∑—Ä–æ—Å–ª—ã–º, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –ø—É–±–ª–∏—á–Ω–∞—è —Å—Ä–µ–¥–∞, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç —Ç–µ –∂–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è, —á—Ç–æ –∏ –≤ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏. –†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–ª—É–±–∞ –ê–Ω–∞—Ç–æ–ª–∏–π –ì–∞–≥–∞—Ä–∏–Ω, –ø–æ–¥–≤–æ–¥—è –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∏ –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏–∏, —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª: ``–¢–µ–º–∞ –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–∞ ‚Äì –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∞–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Ç–µ–º–∞ –≤–æ –≤—Å–µ–º –º–∏—Ä–µ. –†–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–∞ –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–µ, –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–µ –¥–µ–ª–æ, —á—Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—ã –∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏. –°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –º—ã –ø—Ä–∏—à–ª–∏ –∫ –º—ã—Å–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ –≤ –Ω–∞—à–µ–º —Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–µ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–∞–º–æ—Ä–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ–º–æ–π –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –º–æ–≥–ª–∞ –±—ã –æ–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –°–ú–ò –∫–∞–∫ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∞. –ù–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–∞ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –±—ã –±—ã—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω—ã –∫–æ –≤—Å–µ–º —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ ‚Äì –°–ú–ò, –±–ª–æ–≥–µ—Ä–∞–º –∏ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è–º —Å–æ—Ü—Å–µ—Ç–µ–π, –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–º —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –º—ã –º–æ–∂–µ–º —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å —Ç–µ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∏–∑–±–∞–≤—è—Ç –æ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–∞ –¥–≤–æ–π–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–æ–≤, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏—é –ø–æ–¥–≤–µ—Ä–≥–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Å—ã, –∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∫–∞—Ç–æ—Ä—ã –∏–∑ –±–ª–æ–≥–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—ã``. –ü–æ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∞–º –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–π —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è–ª–∏ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä—è–º–æ–π –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥ —Å –≤–ª–∞—Å—Ç—å—é. ¬´–≠–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∫–ª—É–± –ï–∫–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–±—É—Ä–≥–∞¬ª –Ω–∞–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∫ –ø–æ–ª–ø—Ä–µ–¥—É –ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –†–§ –≤ –£—Ä–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–º —Ñ–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–µ –ù–∏–∫–æ–ª–∞—é –¶—É–∫–∞–Ω–æ–≤—É –∑–∞ –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –≤ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∑–∞—Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è —Å –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –≤—Å–µ—Ö —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–π –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–µ.
__label__society Judge Critical of Trump‚Äôs Immunity Claim for White House Aides WASHINGTON (CN) ‚Äî The Justice Department for nearly four hours on Thursday argued the federal courts hold no authority to enforce the House Democrats‚Äô subpoena to former White House counsel Don McGahn to testify before Congress. The White House claimed executive privilege over McGahn‚Äôs testimony when he failed to respond to a subpoena from the House Judiciary Committee in April. Democrats filed a lawsuit, accusing the White House of obstructing the investigation into Trump‚Äôs ties to Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election. Justice Department attorney James Burnham argued that U.S. District Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson holds no jurisdiction to intervene because the judiciary cannot step into interbranch disputes. Puzzled by the claim, Jackson said: ‚ÄúI had understood the whole system as such that that is precisely when the court should be called upon.‚Äù The Obama appointee later asked if the Justice Department‚Äôs position was that the House could under no circumstances go to court. Burnham, after initially dodging the question, responded: ‚ÄúAs a general proposition, I think that is correct your honor.‚Äù Speaking faster than the court reporter could keep pace, he held firm to his claim that the courts at no point in history have enforced a House subpoena to a senior adviser to the president. But Jackson questioned whether his argument ‚Äî focused on the claim that McGahn is entitled to ‚Äúabsolute immunity‚Äù because of his relationship to the president ‚Äî was an overly broad sweep of the heated legal dispute. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt live in a world where being a former executive branch official shields you,‚Äù she said. House attorney Douglas Letter also later dismissed the claim. ‚ÄúAt no point in our history have we had absolute immunity for our president,‚Äù he argued. Still, the Justice Department repeatedly claimed that Trump not only possesses the shielding power but can pass it on to those in his closet circles. Jackson, repeatedly asking for clarification on how she may be wading into the separation of powers, said she did not know from where the claim of absolute immunity arose. House Attorney Megan Barbero said the court absolutely holds the power to enforce the subpoena. ‚ÄúWe are not asking the court to tread any new ground,‚Äù she said. The House attorney later cited the decision in U.S. v. Nixon arising from the Watergate scandal to back her claim. Barbero said that McGahn, interviewed by the special counsel‚Äôs investigation into Russian interference, is a valuable witness in the ongoing probe into whether Trump obstructed justice. She explained McGahn has firsthand knowledge of Trump firing former FBI Director James Comey, the president pressuring Jeff Sessions to walk back his recusal as attorney general from the Mueller investigation and even plans to oust Mueller from his role as special counsel. Burnham said there had been a ‚Äúsea change‚Äù in the laws that he argued govern the case since the Supreme Court passed a 1976 ruling that Barbero leaned heavily on in her argument. But Barbero rejected the claim that Jackson lacks jurisdiction because there are no past examples of cases where the judicial branch intervened in an interbranch dispute like the court now faces. ‚ÄúThe fact that it hadn‚Äôt been done doesn‚Äôt mean it couldn‚Äôt be done,‚Äù the House attorney said. Jackson closed out the hearing notifying both parties that due to a criminal trial she is set to begin presiding over she will have limited time to review the McGahn case in the next two weeks. But the judge added: ‚ÄúI will do my best. I understand the need for expedition.‚Äù Return To Top Copyright ¬© 2019 courthousenews.com
__label__society SEC Disgorgement Order Faces High Court Scrutiny WASHINGTON (CN) ‚Äì The Supreme Court agreed Friday to hear the case of two people ordered to repay $26 million they bilked out of Chinese investors through a program that gives U.S. visas in exchange for foreign investment in the United States. In 2016, the Securities and Exchange Commission accused Charles Liu and Xin Wang of pocketing millions of dollars paid by a group of Chinese investors who were seeking to take advantage of the EB-5 visa program, which offers U.S. visas and a chance at citizenship to people who invest a certain amount in qualifying U.S. business ventures. Most people who are looking for this type of visa invest through programs like the ones run by Liu and Wang that pool together money from multiple foreign investors. Liu and Wang‚Äôs program was purportedly going to fund the construction of a cancer treatment center, but the SEC says the two mismanaged the money they collected and that the center has not opened. In 2017 a California federal judge found Liu and Wang had violated federal securities law through the scheme and ordered them to pay back the full $26.4 million they brought in through their operation, a remedy known as disgorgement. Before the two could appeal the order, the Supreme Court ruled in the case Kokesh v. SEC that disgorgement qualifies as a penalty. Liu and Wang cited Kokesh on appeal to the Ninth Circuit, saying that disgorgement is not among the punishments SEC is authorized to seek under federal securities laws, and that the District Court had been wrong to order it. With the federal appeals court relying on pre-Kokesh, however, it ruled against them, setting the stage for Liu and Wang‚Äôs petition for certiorari. The justices agreed to take up the case this afternoon, without comment, as is their custom. Liu and Wang are represented by Michael Kellogg, an attorney with Kellogg, Hansen, Todd, Figel & Frederick in Washington. Kellogg declined to comment on today‚Äôs development.¬† The Justice Department did not immediately return a request for comment. ¬† Return To Top Copyright ¬© 2019 courthousenews.com
__label__sport Lampard dispels Rudiger claims that he is fit to return London - Frank Lampard on Friday poured cold water on Chelsea defender Antonio Rudiger's reported claim that he is fit to return to action ahead of the Blues' trip to struggling Watford. The 26-year-old German international has been restricted to just one appearance under new coach Lampard after first undergoing knee surgery and then suffering a pelvic injury, but had been quoted this week as saying he was fit and ``itching to play``. ``No, he's not fit. I saw the quotes, whether there was a miscommunication somewhere, he's not fit,`` said Lampard. ``He's going to see a consultant on Monday because he has an ongoing issue in his pelvic area which is bothering him so I was a bit surprised by the quotes. It's a miscommunication, he's not there.`` Rudiger faces a battle to regain his first team place once he does recover, with Kurt Zouma and Fikayo Tomori both impressing during a seven-game winning streak which came to a halt with their 2-1 League Cup defeat to Manchester United on Wednesday. The pair will continue in the centre of defence for the trip to bottom side Watford, who Lampard is not taking lightly despite them failing to win in their opening 10 matches. ``We saw what they did last year, getting big results and regularly being a very strong team and making the FA Cup final,`` said Lampard. ``We cannot underestimate the team that will be hurting because they haven't won for a while and will have every ambition to try and win this game, so I certainly have even more focus on what we need to do.``
__label__not_news *** —Ç–∞–∫ –≤–æ—Ç –∫—É–¥–∞ —É—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –¥–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ç—É–¥–∞ –≥–¥–µ –≤–µ—á–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–≥–¥–µ —Å–∫—Ä–µ–ø—ã –ª–∏—à–Ω–µ–π —Ö—Ä–æ–º–æ—Å–æ–º—ã–∏ —Å—É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç¬© terra
__label__entertainment Valkyria Chronicles 4 Gives Away All Its DLC For Free The Steam version of Valkyria Chronicles 4has just been updated to give everyone who owns the game all of its DLC for nothing. Previously there had been six different updates you could buy, ranging from extra story missions to...a way to unlock swimsuit costumes. The update simply transforms everybody‚Äôs copy of the game to the Complete Edition, which included all DLC for free to begin with. It‚Äôs live now, so you should be able to play right away.
__label__not_news –ö–ª–∞–¥–µ–∑—å –≤–∏—Ç–∞–º–∏–Ω–æ–≤: –ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å —Å–∞–º—ã–π –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–π —Ç–æ—Ä—Ç –∑–∞ 5 –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –∫–æ–Ω–¥–∏—Ç–µ—Ä –ü–æ–±–∞–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–µ–±—è –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω—ã–º –∏¬†–ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–º –¥–µ—Å–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–º –±–µ–∑ –≤—Ä–µ–¥–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä—ã –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ –∏¬†–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ. –î–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–π –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤, –ø–∞—Ä–∞ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏, –Ω–∏–∫–∞–∫–æ–π –≤—ã–ø–µ—á–∫–∏ –∏¬†–≤—Å–µ–≥–æ 264 –∫–∫–∞–ª. –¢–µ, –∫—Ç–æ —É–∂–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—à–µ–ª –Ω–∞¬†–∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–æ–µ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏¬†‚Äî –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ–µ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω—ã–º. –ê¬†–¥–µ—Å–µ—Ä—Ç –Ω–µ¬†–æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω –±—ã—Ç—å –∏–∑¬†–º—É–∫–∏, —è–∏—Ü, –º–∞—Å–ª–∞ –∏¬†—Å–∞—Ö–∞—Ä–∞. –ö–æ–Ω–¥–∏—Ç–µ—Ä—ã —É—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥–∞—é—Ç, —á–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞, —Ç–µ–º –ª–µ–≥—á–µ –∏¬†–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–µ –æ–Ω¬†—É—Å–≤–∞–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è. –î–ª—è –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ç–æ—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –Ω—É–∂–Ω—ã 3 —Ö–ª–µ–±—Ü–∞, –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω–∞ –±–∞–Ω–∞–Ω–∞, –Ω–µ—Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–π –π–æ–≥—É—Ä—Ç –∏¬†–Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ—Ä–æ—à–∫–∞ –∫–∞–∫–∞–æ –∏¬†5 –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏. –°–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å –∫—Ä–µ–º: –≤¬†–±–ª–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–µ –≤–∑–±–∏—Ç—å –π–æ–≥—É—Ä—Ç –∏¬†–ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω—É –±–∞–Ω–∞–Ω–∞. –û—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –±–∞–Ω–∞–Ω –Ω–∞—Ä–µ–∑–∞—Ç—å —Ç–æ–Ω–∫–∏–º–∏ –∫—Ä—É–∂–æ—á–∫–∞–º–∏. –•–ª–µ–±—Ü—ã –ø—Ä–æ–º–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –∫—Ä–µ–º–æ–º –∏¬†–≤—ã–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–∏–π—Å—è –±–∞–Ω–∞–Ω. –°–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å –≤¬†3 —Å–ª–æ—è, —É–∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏—Ç—å –ø–∏—Ä–∞–º–∏–¥–∫—É, –ø—Ä–∏—Å—ã–ø–∞—Ç—å –ø–æ—Ä–æ—à–∫–æ–º –∫–∞–∫–∞–æ. –ù–∞¬†–ø–∞—Ä—É —á–∞—Å–æ–≤ —É–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å –≤¬†—Ö–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–∫ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Ç–∫–∏. –•–ª–µ–±—Ü—ã —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è, —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—è—Å—å –º—è–≥–∫–∏–º–∏ –∏¬†—Å–æ—á–Ω—ã–º–∏, –∫–∞–∫ –±–∏—Å–∫–≤–∏—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ—Ä–∂–∏. –°–∞—Ö–∞—Ä –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –Ω–µ¬†—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç—Å—è, –±–∞–Ω–∞–Ω –¥–∞–µ—Ç –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ–µ –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Å–ª–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ù–æ¬†–ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ —Å–ª–∞–¥–µ–Ω—å–∫–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –≤–∑—è—Ç—å —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–µ —Ö–ª–µ–±—Ü—ã, –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–∂–∫–æ –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è –∏–ª–∏ –º–µ–¥–∞. –≠—Ç–æ —É–¥–∞—á–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∫–ª–µ—Ç—á–∞—Ç–∫–∏, –∫—Ä–∞—Ö–º–∞–ª–∞ –∏ –º–æ–ª–æ—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∂–∏—Ä–∞. –ë–∞–Ω–∞–Ω –∏ –∫–∞–∫–∞–æ –¥–∞—é—Ç —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π –∑–∞—Ä—è–¥ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏. –ò —Ç–æ, –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–µ, —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç —Ç—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ—Ñ–∞–Ω, –∏–∑ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º –≤—ã—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç —Å–µ—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–Ω–∏–Ω ‚Äî ¬´–≥–æ—Ä–º–æ–Ω —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å—è¬ª. –í –π–æ–≥—É—Ä—Ç–µ –≤—Å–µ —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –ª—É—á—à–µ–µ –∏–∑ –º–æ–ª–æ–∫–∞. –ê —Ö–ª–µ–±—Ü—ã –∏–∑ —Ü–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ ‚Äî –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –∫–ª–∞–¥–µ–∑—å –≤–∏—Ç–∞–º–∏–Ω–æ–≤ –∏ –º–∏–Ω–µ—Ä–∞–ª–æ–≤: –≤–∏—Ç–∞–º–∏–Ω—ã –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã –í, –ê, –ï, –∞–Ω—Ç–∏–æ–∫—Å–∏–¥–∞–Ω—Ç—ã, –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ–∏–Ω—ã, –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑–æ, –º–∞–≥–Ω–∏–π, –Ω–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–π –∏ –∫–∞–ª–∏–π. –ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Ö.
__label__society –ë–µ–ª–æ—Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–≥—Ä—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É –í –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–µ –ë–µ–ª–∞—Ä—É—Å–∏ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–µ–Ω—ã —Ä–∞—Å—Ç—É—â–∏–º –∏–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è. –ü—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏–µ –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–∏ –≤–ª–∞—Å—Ç–µ–π –æ—Ç—Ä–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–≤–æ–∑ —Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä–æ–≤ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ü—ã –Ω–µ —É–≤–µ–Ω—á–∞–ª–∏—Å—å —É—Å–ø–µ—Ö–æ–º, –ø–∏—à—É—Ç naviny.by. –ë–æ–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Ç–µ–º–∞ –í–æ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–µ–π —Ç–æ—Ä–≥–æ–≤–ª–µ —Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä–∞–º–∏ —É –Ω–∞—Å –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—è–≤–ª—è—Ç—å—Å—è –¥–∏—Å–±–∞–ª–∞–Ω—Å: –ø—Ä–∏ —Å–ø–∞–¥–µ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∂ –Ω–∞—Ä–∞—â–∏–≤–∞–µ–º –∏–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç, —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω–µ–º –∑–∞—Å–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –°–æ–≤–µ—Ç–∞ –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –≥–ª–∞–≤–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–π –†—É–º–∞—Å. –ù–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –∏–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç –≤–æ–¥—ã, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—è –º–∏–Ω–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—É—é –∏ –≥–∞–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—É—é, –≤ —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–º –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–∏–ª—Å—è –Ω–∞ 6%, –∫–æ–Ω–¥–∏—Ç–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∏–∑–¥–µ–ª–∏–π ‚Äî –Ω–∞ 15%, –ø–∏–≤–∞ ‚Äî –Ω–∞ 19%, —à–æ–∫–æ–ª–∞–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–∑–¥–µ–ª–∏–π ‚Äî –Ω–∞ 30%, –ø—à–µ–Ω–∏—á–Ω–æ–π –º—É–∫–∏ ‚Äî –≤ 2 —Ä–∞–∑–∞. –í —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ —Å —ç—Ç–∏–º –ø—Ä–µ–º—å–µ—Ä-–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏–ª —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ ¬´–ë–µ–ª–≥–æ—Å–ø–∏—â–µ–ø—Ä–æ–º¬ª —Ä–∞–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —Å–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞—é—â–µ–π—Å—è —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ê —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏—è –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥–∏—Ç —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–º: –∑–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–π –≥–æ–¥ –≤ –±–µ–ª–æ—Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏—Ö –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–∞—Ö —Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∏–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ –º–µ–Ω—å—à–µ –æ—Ç–µ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö. –ö –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—É, —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏ –≤ ¬´–ë–µ–ª–≥–æ—Å–ø–∏—â–µ–ø—Ä–æ–º–µ¬ª, –∑–∞ —è–Ω–≤–∞—Ä—å‚Äî—Å–µ–Ω—Ç—è–±—Ä—å —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–µ–º —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–Ω–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 24 —Ç—ã—Å—è—á —Ç–æ–Ω–Ω –Ω–∞ 3% –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–≥–æ–¥–Ω–µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —É–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –≤–µ—Å –æ—Ç–µ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª 79,9% –∏ —Å–Ω–∏–∑–∏–ª—Å—è –Ω–∞ 2,2%. –ö–∞–∫ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–∏–ª–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ—Ä–Ω–µ, –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω—ã–µ –±–µ–ª–æ—Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å–µ—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞—é—Ç –∑–∞–∫—É–ø–∞—Ç—å –∏–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä—ã, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏–ª –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –∑–∞–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–µ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ ¬´–ë–µ–ª–≥–æ—Å–ø–∏—â–µ–ø—Ä–æ–º¬ª: ¬´–ú—ã –Ω–µ –ø–æ–π–¥–µ–º –Ω–∞ –æ–±–º–∞–Ω –ø–æ–∫—É–ø–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –º–æ–Ω–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∏ –∏ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ —Å–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–µ —Ä–µ–≥–ª–∞–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º —Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä—ã —Å –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∂–∏, –Ω–æ –æ–Ω–∏ —Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞
